Bella es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos. Comenzó el negocio hace años atrás para poder mejorar  sus ingresos. También vende comida los fines de semana para tener un ingreso adicional para sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera. 

En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a viernes en su negocio de comercio y los fines de semana con la venta de comida. Tiene muchas proyecciones en el futuro por eso quiere mejorar sus ingresos y el de sus hijos haciendo un préstamo  para comprar perfumes, ropa y joyas. En el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y tener un negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Bella is a hard-working woman who has a business selling clothes and cosmetics.  She started this business several years ago, in order to be able to improve her income.  She also sells food on the weekends to bring in additional income for her two children, as she is a single mother.

She currently works from Monday through Friday in her retail business, and on the weekends selling food.  She has many plans for the future as she wants to improve her income for her family, so she is taking a loan to buy perfume, clothing and jewelry.

In the future, she would like to improve her home and have a well-established business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfume.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to perform maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: El señor Eusebio es un hombre muy trabajador y padre de familia preocupado por el bienestar de la familia. Hace 12 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social, que por lo regular este tipo de vivienda son muy pequeñas; cuentan con recamaras  muy estrechas donde muy apenas cabe una cama y un closet, por tal motivo el comenzó la construcción en la parte de enfrente, un cuarto mas para extender la vivienda y de esta manera tener mayor espacio. Para que Eusebio pueda terminar el cuarto necesita colocar el techo de losa, lo cual necesita comprar cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra. Para poder sostener los gastos del hogar el y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes.
texts.en:
Señor Eusebio is a very hard-working man and a father who is concerned with his family's well-being.  He bought his social-interest home twelve years ago.  These homes are normally very small; they have very narrow bedrooms, where there is barely room for a bed and a closet.  For this reason, he has started building a room in front to extend his home, and in this way be able to have more space.

In order for Eusebio to be able to finish the room, he needs to put on the roof.  To do this, he needs to buy cement and sand, and to pay for labor.  He and his wife both work at a factory from Monday through Friday to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis y su esposa  son unas personas emprendedoras que les gusta el negocio por tal motivo pensó en poner venta de ropa usada  en una de las colonias de la ciudad, el cual se podrían desarrollar como unos buenos negociantes. Con el negocio ya tiene 4 años ofreciendo a su clientela una buena atención, un mejor servicio y variedad de estilos de ropa. Desde que comenzó su negocio vio que daba resultados por lo que siguió adelante ya que seria la forma de tener un ingreso extra aparte del que percibía en la maquiladora. José Luis desea comprar ropa de temporada de tiempo de frio, por que en este momento ya sus clientes le están solicitando y ve que es una buena oportunidad de tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señor José Luis and his wife are enterprising people who enjoy working.  For this reason, they decided to sell used clothes in one of the city neighborhoods, and this has allowed them to develop into good business-people.  They have been tending well to their customers through this business for four years now, offering good service and a variety of clothing styles.

Since he began this business, he has seen it provide results that kept him moving forward.  It has also been an additional source of income to what he earns at the factory.

José Luis wants to buy seasonal clothes for the cold weather, because his customers are already starting to look for them at this time and he sees it as a good opportunity to bring in better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for his business.

loans.name: Vireak

texts.en:
Vireak is 36 years old and is a grocery seller with his wife. They earn $15 per day and have four children who are 13, 10, 4 and 2 years old. Two of their children are in school. Every month, Vireak has to spend $90 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. He wants to support all of his children to study at least until finishing high school. 

Vireak would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy more grocery goods to sell in his store because he doesn’t have enough types of good to sell.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old and married. She has 3 children aged 28, 22 and 20.

Rose works as a farmer in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Rose also raises pigs to help augment her income. Rose requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed. Rose hopes to have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Marieto

texts.en:
Marieto is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Marieto has a shop that buys and sells coconuts for copra. He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts for copra. Marieto is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marieto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 52 years old and lives in Locus, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with no children. 

Wilma has a shop that sells dry goods, particularly rice. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase 10 sacks of rice to sell. Wilma has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 60-year-old married woman from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She makes a living as a farmer and tills her land to plant rice. Wilma also raises pigs to sell and earns about 9,000 PHP monthly doing these activities. 

Wilma is requesting a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, piglets, and and pig feed. She hopes to continue earning and providing for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, piglets, and pig feed

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 42 years old and is married with seven children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Pacita has run a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She is a new HSPFI member.

Pacita is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 56 years old and is married with five children. She is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for 15 years. Alicia is able to provide for her family through her work.

Alicia is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seed and fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to improve her farm and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Lophay

texts.en:
Lophay is 54 years old and is a motorbike taxi driver who earns 5 USD daily. His wife is a gardener who earns 2 USD each day. The couple has four children, two of whom are studying and two who are working in Thailand, each earning 5 USD every day. Each month, Lophay has to spend 75 USD on rent, 3.5 USD on electricity, 25 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on other expenses. 

Lophay is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy a new motorbike for his business as his current motorbike is old. In the future he has two plans: to buy a small car and continue his taxi service and to open a motorbike repair shop since he has some knowledge of engine repair.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is a married woman with three adult children. She lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato where she has a farm and a sari-sari (retail) store. Amparo grows rice on her land and sells her harvest at her town’s market. She also sells items such as shampoo, soap, and canned goods at her sari-sari store.

Amparo is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seed and fertilizer. Amparo hopes to progress in her life.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is married and has four children. She is 25 years old and lives in Caluya, Sapang Dalaga.

Minda sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 12,000 to purchase fishing nets and other materials for her fishing business.

Minda has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is 42 years old and married. Ernesto has been doing rice farming for 10 years. He earns about 8000 PHP per month from his farming. Ernesto also raises pigs in his backyard. He works hard to provide for his family's needs.

Ernesto has requested this loan to purchase more piglets and feed. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Jose has a pigpen and sells matured & grown pigs. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for pigs.
Jose is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jose hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

loans.name: Jermelito

texts.en:
Jermelito is a farmer from Surallah, South Cotabato. He is 48 years old and married. His 7 children are between the ages of 5 and 20 years.

Jermelito has been growing and selling rice for 15 years. He earns about 5000 PHP per month from farming. Jermelito also works as a part-time driver. He works hard to provide the needs of his family and send his children to school.

Jermelito is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to have a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe 38 years old and is a married woman. She has 2 children, aged 8 and 13. Ma. Fe’s husband works as a farmer and driver.

Ma. Fe is also a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice on their land. Ma. Fe also sells fresh fish to the people in her community. She buys fish from fishermen in her town. Ma. Fe works hard to help provide for her family’s needs. She has applied for this loan to buy fertilizers and more fish to sell.

In the future, Ma. Fe hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 61 years old and lives in Marapong, Sibutad. She is a widow with 2 children.

Thelma has a shop that sells assorted grocery items and other dry goods. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP for her granddaughter's tuition fee.

Thelma has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to pay for her granddaughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Ma. Hazel

texts.en:
Maria Hazel is a 37-year-old married woman with 3 children ages 19, 14 and 5. She and her husband are both farmers. Rice is the main crop that they grow to sell. Ma. Hazel works hard to help her husband provide for their needs and send their children to school.

She applied for this loan so she could buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. Ma. Hazel is hoping for this loan to help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She is 40 years old and has 3 children aged 22, 20 and 18.

Magdalena has been in the hog-raising business for 15 years. She earns 5,000 PHP per month from her business. Magdalena also owns a parcel of land where she grows rice crops. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed. Magdalena hopes to succeed in her ventures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a farmer working in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She helps her family till their land and plant rice crops. Marissa had to stop her studies due to financial difficulties in her family. Marissa works hard to support her family and save for her schooling.

Marissa requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to go back to school and finish her studies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.

Celso has a pigpen and sells matured, grown pigs. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy animal feed for pigs.

Celso is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Celso hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 49-year-old farmer from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. He is still single and hopes to have his own family someday.

Nelson tills his own land where he grows rice crops. He earns about 10,000 PHP from farming. He plans to use his loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. Nelson hopes to earn more and save for his future family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is married with six children. Concepcion is 61 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga.

To earn a living, Concepcion is a "nipa palm" weaver business. She has had this business for 20 years. Each month, Concepcion earns approximately PHP 2,600. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase nipa palm in order her to weave and sell to community. Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase nipa palm in order her to weave and sell to community

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong, 27 years old, is a food seller and is employed as a cook sometimes for other parties. He earns $5 per day. He lives with his parents, a sister and one nephew. His sister is a vegetable seller at the market and earns $5 per day. Every month, he has to spend $100 on food, $15 on electricity, $25 on school fees, $8 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $800 to buy wood and thatch to expand the place where he sells food. He used to work in Thailand and he came back to sell vegetables with his sister. Now he has his own career selling food. He plans to buy vegetables in stock from the plantation owners to sell when he has more money because with this business he doesn’t need to spend much time and he gets a good profit.

loans.use: To buy wood and thatch to expand his place of business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 38-years-old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 

Alberto has a food shop, or carenderia, that makes & sells viands (food items or tasty dishes) like pinakbit, adobo & sampayna. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Alberto is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Alberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Thonarith

texts.en:
Thonarith, 46, resides with his wife in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Thonarith is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of USD 10 per day. When he is not fishing, he grows rice and raise pigs to generate more income. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 100 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. Thonarith is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family use.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie is 29 years old and lives in Small Potungan, Concepcion. She is married with one child.
 
Emie has a general store. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase assorted stocks for her general store.

Emie has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase assorted stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She earns a living through rice farming and raising hogs. Remedios helps her husband grow rice on their land. She raises her pigs in their backyard piggery. Remedios works hard to help augment their family income.

Remedios is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed. She hopes to have a progressive life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 38-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Nora has a retail shop that sells spices, food seasoning & vegetables like potatoes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5000 to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

Nora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Gerry is a single person. Gerry is 30 years old and lives in Katipunan,Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur.
Gerry has an abaca  (palm leaf) plantation and earns approximately PHP 6000 each month. He has requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase farm inputs for his abaca plantation.PHP

Gerry has been a member of PMPC for almost eight months.In the future,Gerry hopes to earn more than PHP 6000 a month.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for his abaca plantation

loans.name: Sari

texts.en: Sari, 37, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sari and her husband sell firewood, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 100 on food and USD 65 on the other necessary expenses. Sari is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase piglets to raise for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Jenisa Group

texts.en:
Jenisa is 32 years old and lives in Molave. She is married with 3 children. 
Jenisa has a business that sells dried fish. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000  to purchase more dried fish to sell.
Jenisa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. Jenisa is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en:
Emerlita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. 
Emerlita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Emerlita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emerlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Sareth, 52, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sareth sells porridge and Chinese noodle, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a soldier, earning an income of USD 5. Each month, the family has to spend USD 100 on food and USD 32 on the other necessary expenses. Sareth is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 49-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 16 years old. Alicia lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato where she has a farm and a sari-sari store business.

Alicia grows rice crops on her land and sells her harvest at the market. At her sari-sari store, she sells items like vinegar, soy sauce and dried fish. Alicia plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as dried fish and canned goods. She hopes to have a stable income that will sustain her family and her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as dried fish and canned goods

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is married with four children. Imelda is 53 years old and lives in Molave Zamboanga Del Sur.

To earn a living, Imelda has a general store business. She has had this business for 26 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 8,000. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay the tuition for her daughter in college. Imelda has been a member of PMPC for two years.

In the future, Imelda hopes to earn 20,000 PHP a month this year.

loans.use: to pay the college tuition for her daughter

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 63 years old and married with seven children. She is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. Editha grows rice and corn crops and vegetables on her land. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Editha hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai, 53, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Hai is employed at a non-government organization, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Her husband is a soldier and a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 55 on other necessary expenses. Hai is requesting a loan of USD 250 to purchase school uniforms for the children to go to school. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms for her children

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Marissa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and rice by the kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and rice to sell.

Marissa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marissa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and rice to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 54 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. She is engaged in farming. She grows rice and corn crops to sell. Emilia also sells chorizo and ukay-ukay (used clothes) to the people in her community.

Emilia has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable income that would help sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Joelynda

texts.en: Joelynda is a farmer from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She is married and has three children, ages 22, 14 and 3. Joelynda’s husband is also a farmer. Together, they till their land and plant rice and corn crops. Joelynda does her best to improve their business and support the family. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, a 48-year-old married mother of five children, the oldest 23 years old, is a farmer who has been growing and selling rice for 23 years. She earns about 5,000 Philippine pesos per month. Josephine plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides, and hopes to be able to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long, 27, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Long is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3.33 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 4.66 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 15 on the other necessary expenses. Long is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase clothes and cosmetics to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian earns a living through farming. She is 43 years old and married with three children. Her oldest child is 17 years old.

Lilian helps her husband till their land in Surallah, South Cotabato. They grow rice and corn crops to sell in their community. Lilian requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Lilian hopes to earn more and save for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. The oldest child is 20 years old. Lilian and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice crops and cassava on their land. Lilian said that they are able to buy their basic needs and send their kids to school through the farm.

Lilian has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to continue earning from their farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Bunthorn

texts.en: Bunthorn, 40, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Bunthorn is a tailor, earning an income of USD 2.60 per day. Her husband buys green coconuts to resell, earning an income of USD 20 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 55 on the other necessary expenses. Bunthorn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to transport coconuts to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to trasport coconuts to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 35 years old and married woman with three children. The oldest child is 15 years old. Luzviminda’s husband is a farmer.

Luzviminda is also a farmer. She and her husband works together to keep their farm productive. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Luzviminda will use her loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Merlyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Merlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Chhorn, 49, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Chhorn is a farmer and grows vegetables, earning an income of around USD 4 per day. Her husband buys fish to resell, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. Chhorn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike to transport clay pots and other clay products to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport clay pots and other clay products to sell

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Melania has a grocery store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 25 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Melania is well known in their community as a strong person and a  very hardworking mother. In the future, Melania hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, spices, noodles and drinks for her store

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela is a married woman with two adult children. She works as a farmer in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Manuela primarily grows rice crops to sell. She needs farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds. That’s why she requested this loan. Manuela hopes to have a better income so she can make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Evelyn has a shop that sells beverages like soft drinks & light liquors. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks & beverages to sell.

Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Sylvia Montano Group

texts.en:
Sylvia is 63 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sibutad. She is married with four children. 

Sylvia has a shop that sells assorted groceries and dry goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries worth PHP 10,000.

Sylvia has been a member of PMPC for two years. Sylvia is the leader of a three-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Sen is a 51-year-old married woman who comes from a low-income family in the Baray district of the Kompong Tom province. Everyday, Mrs. Sen sells fish caught by her husband from the river and the lake in and around the village. The couple works well together in running this business smoothly to provide for their livelihood. They typically earn an income of around $5 USD per day in order to meet the needs for daily expenses. Mrs. Sen has four children, three of whom are single and the other one is married. Two of her children are now working in a garment factory and, like other villagers, get their salary monthly. Now, Mrs. Sen and her husband are asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase a fishing trap and other fishing materials because their old ones are broken. In the future, this couple hopes that they will able to raise some small fish by themselves so that they can generate more profit.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing trap and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 45-year-old married woman with five children. She lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato with her family.

Nancy has a farming business. She grows rice crops and vegetables to sell to her community. Nancy is able to provide for her family through her business. She plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. Nancy hopes to have a better income to sustain her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Andrita Calapiz Group

texts.en:
Andrita is a widow with four children. Andrita is 65 years-old and lives in East Poblacion, Rizal.

Andrita sells assorted groceries to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 in order to purchase housing materials needed for house repair.

Andrita has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for four years.  In the future, Andrita hope to improve the living situation of her family from the income generated from her business.

Andrita is the leader of a four person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials (plywood, nails. etc.)

loans.name: Si

texts.en: Si, 24 years old, is a grocery seller, earning $3 per day. Her husband works as a Tuk Tuk driver (a motorcycle-based taxi), earning $4 each day. Her husband has been running this business activity for many years. She and her husband would like to purchase a new motorbike but they lack capital so they need to apply for a loan in amount of $500 USD from HKL. Her husband hopes that when he buys a new motorbike, he will service his clients quicker. Clients’ satisfaction is the one way to improve his family’s financial stability. This humble couple has two kids who are living under their care. She and her husband are very thankful to all donors. In the future, Si will be trying to support her children to study until they finish university. This is her first loan with HKL and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 37 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Eliza has a retail shop that sells spices and vegetables such as cabbages and squash. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 in order to buy vegetables and spices to sell.

Eliza is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI.  In the future, Eliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Estrella Tecson Group

texts.en:
Estrella is married with four children. Estrella is 56 years-old and lives in La Libertad Zamboanga Del Norte.

Estrella sells grocery items and dry goods in order to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,600 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase ten sacks of feed and other supplies for hog fattening.

Estrella has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for two months. 

Estrella is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of feed and other supplies for hog fattening.

location.town: La Libertad, Gutalac, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina lives with her husband and three grown-up children. She has a business selling different products such as canned goods, noodles, coffee and snack foods in her small store located in their community.  She has had her store for three years. Through this business, she supports herself and helps her husband cover their household expenses.

Avelina will invest her loan in buying merchandise: snacks, soda, oil, rice and beans for her store. This merchandise will enable her to continue working in her business and support her family. More than anything, she wants her son to study and prepare himself for the future.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, canned goods, noodles, coffee and spices to sell.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is a married man with one child. He lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato where he manages a rice farm.

Ramon has been engaged in farming for 30 years. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earns about 10,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Ramon also started raising pigs to expand his source of income. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pig feed.

In the future, he hopes to become a successful businessman. He also hopes for his child to have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pig feed.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children.
 
Marciana runs a retail shop that sells fruits & vegetables and has been in business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fruits & vegetables to sell.

Marciana is a new member of HSPFI.  She hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits & vegetables for sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 35 years old and lives in Mabini, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Lina has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3000 each month. 

Lina requests a loan of 16,500 to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending.  She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is married with one son.  For over eight years she has run a sari-sari store (small store).  Gilda has worked with much effort and dedication. 

The profits from her business have been favorable and allowed her to keep her store running.

Gilda is requesting a loan to buy products such as cooking oil, soft drinks, bread, soups, cookies, coffee and sodas.  

Her dream is to expand her business and keep it active.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, snack foods, spices and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
From 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., Josephine is in her store attending to neighborhood customers who shop for their families. 

Her store has become a great opportunity for generating income, especially for her family.  Josephine started working to support her four children, most especially to pay their school fees.

Now she wants a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy different products so she can offer her customers more options, thus increasing her income.

In the future, Josephine hopes she will see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy sweets, beverages, cooking oil, and bread for her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years. Delia earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear [clothes].

Delia is borrowing 10,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her beauty parlor business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Milagros buys and sells fruits, vegetables & charcoal per kilogram.  She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fruits & vegetables to sell.

Milagros is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Milagros hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits & vegetables for sell

loans.name: Reynold

texts.en:
Reynold is 26 years-old and is a married man with a  three year-old child. He is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. Reynold grows rice crops to sell. He requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials. Reynold hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. 

In the future, Reynold hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm materials.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 48 years-old and married man with three children. The oldest child is 26 years-old.

Ricardo is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Ricardo works hard to provide for his family’s needs and to send his children to school.

Ricardo has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials. He hopes to have a stable income that would help sustain his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Raising hogs is Valentina's primary source of income. She has been in this activity for one year. When the hogs are ready for disposal, Valentina sells them to the butchers who come down into their village. She usually earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) for each hog.

Valentina is now 43 years-old and was proud to give a good education for her one child through the income she generated from her business.  

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccine for the hogs to ensure proper growth and good nutrition. 

In the future, she would like to strengthen her hog raising business in order to save for future expenses, especially as she gets older and older.

loans.use: to buy vaccine and feed to raise to for her business

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is a 30-year-old married woman with two children aged 13 and 5. She is a corn farmer and pig grower. Ritchel earns about 10,000 PHP per month doing these activities.

Ritchel has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and feeds.  She is hoping to become a successful businesswoman someday. She also hopes to see her children finish college and become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a married man with two children aged 17 and 9. He is from Surallah, South Cotabato where he has a farming business. Roberto grows rice and vegetables on his land. He works hard to improve his harvest and income.

Roberto has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. He hopes for this loan to help improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Gloria has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from AVON & NATASHA. She has had been in business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing & beauty products to sell.

Gloria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing & beauty products for sell

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 53 years old and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 8 children. 

Leonor has a furniture making business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month.  

She has a requested a loan to purchase equipment for making furniture.
 
Leonor has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. 

In the future, Leonor hopes to have a big furniture business.  She is a MIGS member of PMPC.  

She is a hardworking mother who takes good care of her family.  Leonor has a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase equipments for her furniture making business

loans.name: Ronita

texts.en:
Ronita is a 43-year-old married woman with 2 children. 

She farms for a living and grows rice and vegetables to sell in her community. 

Ronita does her best to help provide for her family's daily needs. 

She requests a loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.  

Ronita hopes to improve her family’s living situation from her income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some small pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 27-year-old married woman from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She has 2 children aged 4 and 9. 

Rowena’s husband runs a transport business.

Rowena is in the business of raising hogs. She has a backyard piggery. 

She plans to use her loan to buy more piglets and feed.  Rowena hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Rosario has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & rice per kilogram.  She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & rice for sell.

Rosario is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & rice for sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 47-year-old with four children.  She sells soap, shampoo, lotion and accessories.  

Marivic confesses that at one time, without any income, she gave up.  Then she gathered all her strength in hand because she is responsible for being a mother. 

With an idea brought by her mother, she started selling personal products from her home.

In the countryside, most of the women are housewives. They usually gather in Marivic`s house to try new products and to buy something. 

Marivic is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase new products to sell to the people of her community. 

She hopes that in the future her business improves and expands.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, lotion and accessories for her personal collection in her business.

loans.name: Lzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 45 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with 3 children. 

She runs a general store and has been in business for 5 years.  She requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more stock for her store.

Luzminda has been a MIGS member of PMPC for four years.  She is proud because they help her in terms of money when she needs it.  

In the future, Luzminda hopes to own a grocery store.  She is described as an honest person, a loving wife and good mother to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a 40-year-old married man with a 7-year-old child. 

He is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. Ruben plants rice on his land and sells his harvest to traders in his town.  Ruben also raises pigs in his backyard.

Ruben has requested a loan to purchase feed, fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.  He hopes to have a stable income to sustain his family and his child's education.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 37-year-old woman. She is married and has grown up children. 

Sonia raises and sells pigs, which helps her cover her family's expenses. 

Sonia wants to purchase feed for her pig; but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she wants to take a loan of PHP 7,000. 

When Sonia takes the loan, which is to be repaid on a weekly basis, she will able to purchase feed, vaccine and vitamins for the pig she is raising. 

She will be able to increase her family's income and create better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Gemelita

texts.en:
Gemelita is 42 years old and lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City.  She is married with 2 children. 

Gemelita buys and sells dried fish for a living and has been doing so for 3 years.  She has requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase different kinds of dried fish for her retail business. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Gemelita hopes to have a store in the market so she can display her dried fish. 

Gemelita is a good mother of her children.  She is a happy member of PMPC because they can help her overcome her financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase different kind of dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
This is Alberto, 55, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Perlita, a buy-and-sell trader, and mother to his four children. By the grace of God, Alberto has managed to support his children's schooling. He is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alberto operates a Jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have one (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which is paying boundary (a fee) each day. Alberto and his wife also manage their fruit-and-vegetables stand. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 350 every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy new accessories and parts for their jeepney. Part of the loan will be used to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business.  

Alberto hopes his business grows more this coming year and dreams to be able to give his children a high-quality education through all his hard work at his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members** to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an earning opportunity, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every-day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

**All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their Jeepney unit

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús, vive en casa propia en la zona oriental del país en zona urbana junto a  su compañero de vida Manuel,  mamá y dos sobrinos menores de edad por quienes ella es quien responde económicamente a falta de sus padres. Mientras Manuel es albañil, Teresa de Jesús ha logrado instalar desde hace muchos años y después de inmenso esfuerzo una tienda en su misma casa de residencia, por medio de la cual provee a sus vecinos productos de primera necesidad como granos básicos, alimentos enlatados, carne de pollo, embutidos, pañales desechables, entre otros.  El ingreso generado por Teresa es lo que provee el alimento diario de esta familia además sirve para pagos de los servicios básicos de agua y luz, dado que los ingresos que percibe su esposo son muy bajos para cubrir las necesidades de éste hogar. La actitud positiva, responsable  y emprendedora de Teresa es la que ha permitido que  éste no sea primer crédito que maneje y esa buena experiencia  es la que ha hecho que solicite nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para incrementar la variedad de productos que sus clientes están demandando: detergentes, aceites, leche, medicinas, azúcar refinada,  desodorantes antitranpirantes para hombre y mujeres; espera que con esto pueda incrementar sus ventas y consecuentemente sus ganancias a fin de mejorar el sostenimiento económico de toda su familia.-
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús lives in her own home in the eastern part of the country.  She lives in an urban area with her life companion Manuel, her mom, and two young nephews for whom she is financially responsible as they are orphans.  

While Manuel works in construction, Teresa de Jesús managed many years ago, with much effort, managed to set up a store in her home.  With this store, she provides her neighbors with everyday products such as bulk grains, canned food, chicken, sausages, disposable diapers, and other things.  The income Teresa generates is what covers the daily food expenses for her family as well as paying for the basic utilities (water and electricity), as her husband's income is too low to cover these necessary household expenses.

Teresa's positive attitude and responsible and enterprising nature has allowed her to achieve this.  This is not her first loan that she has managed, and as a result of her good experience, she is requesting her ninth loan through INTEGRAL.  This loan is to increase her variety of products to meet demand from her customers, by buying detergents, oils, milk, medicines, white sugar, antiperspirant deodorants for men and women, among other things.

She hopes that with this she will be able to increase her sales and subsequently her earnings, with the end goal of improving the financial situation for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy detergents, oils, milk, medicines, white sugar, antiperspirant deodorants for men and women, among other things that she doesn't currently have.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts such as a wheel and a chain, and also to purchase feed for a hog-raising business

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
This is Estella, 41, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Hernanie, and is a mother to their three children. One is studying in college, another is in elementary school, and the oldest is currently seeking an entry-level job. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support the schooling of her two children. 

Estella operates a variety store, a mini food house, and a food delivery. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells cooked viands (food items) and delivers cooked food for added income. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She has a minimum of 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and raw ingredients for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Estella hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to buy a car for their food delivery business just as she fervently hopes that her two children will be able to finish their studies and graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional dry fish.

loans.name: Hermogina

texts.en: Hermogina is 58 years old and lives in Casul, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Hermogina has a business selling fish. She earns about 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Hermogina has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase 12 boxes of fish to sell. Hermogina has been a member of PMPC for 11 years.

loans.use: to purchase 12 boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 50 years old and lives in Caluya, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with 4 children. 
To earn a living, Teresa has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 5,100 each month doing this type of work. Teresa has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase dried fish to sell.
Teresa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase 5 boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Haydar

texts.ru: Хайдар житель Яванского района. Он женат. Ему 51 год. Его жена домохозяйка, а сын находится на заработках в России. Сам Хайдар у себя дома разводит скот. Он в основном откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается 22 года. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Haydar lives in the Yavan district.  He is 51 years old and married.  His wife is a homemaker, and his son is working in Russia.  Haydar breeds livestock at home.  He primarily fattens up and sells cattle.  He has been involved in this business for 22 years.  Haydar is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of cattle.

loans.use: to buy several heads of cattle

loans.name: Shoy

texts.en:
Shoy lives in the Kompong Speu province.  To make a living, she has planted crops on her farmland, with her husband for the past twenty years. 

They can typically profit about $5 a day and that helps to cover their family’s needs.  They are blessed with four children; two are studying and one is a young child who lives under their care.  Another is employed as a foreman in the construction field. 

This is the rainy season and a good time for the couple to start a new crop, but their cow is too old and it cannot plow any longer.  Because of a lack of funds, Shoy and her husband request a loan to purchase a new cow.  

Shoy hopes to expand the size of her house and send their children to school through at least high school.  Shoy is very happy and thanks the lenders who made her first loan possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new cow for replacing the old one.

loans.name: Yandag

texts.en: Yandag is 56 years old and lives with his son and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt (nomadic tent), in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His son is a college student. His wife sews and makes clothes as a family business. He and his wife started this business in 2006. They are planning to expand their business operation by purchasing new equipment and applying new sewing techniques. They are currently operating this business from their home. He believes that shortly he will gain more experience and become a successful businessman. He is a diligent man who says, "With the bank loan, I want to improve my business. In the future, my family wants to have a tailoring service center." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase new equipment and materials for their business.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and materials for the family's sewing business

loans.name: Nhạnh's Group

texts.en: Nhạnh owns and operates a business making and selling dried goods in her community. She is a 62-year-old woman living in the Yên Phong district, Bac Ninh province. Nhạnh is married and has four grown-up children. Nhạnh has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2009, Nhạnh joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and enable her to engage in business activities. Nhạnh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,840,000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is now requesting a new loan of 8,736,000 VND which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients. This will be her third loan from SEDA. Nhạnh plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies. Nhạnh is the leader of a four-member group accessing a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yen Hau. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nhàn is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising pigs. 2. Sinh is a 44-year-old man who is requesting a 8,736,000 VND loan to support his business raising chickens, swans and ducks. 3. Thúy is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 8,736,000 VND loan to support her business raising pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Herlenbaatar

texts.en: Herlenbaatar is 45 years old and lives with his wife and son in a 'ger', a Mongolian yurt, in Dundgovi province of Mongolia. He started his business in 1990 by making home equipment and tools out of steel. He has many years of work experience and has many regular customers such as shopkeepers. He mentions that working outside during the winter is very difficult. He is planning to expand his business operation by opening his workplace and office. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I am doing my best to live well. I want to have a workplace so that I can increase my income and business." He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to buy equipment and materials to build a workplace.

loans.use: To buy equipment and materials to build a workplace.

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru: Махфират проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Махфират уже три  года как занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа коровы, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Makhfirat lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 29 years old, married and has four children.  Makhfirat has been involved in animal husbandry for three years.  She breeds livestock for future sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow, in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and has five children: three sons and two daughters. 

She and her husband are rice farmers, earning $4 each day.  Both are skilled and have many years of farming experience.  It's a skill they learned from their ancestors.  

To earn a better living, this modest couple requests a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike.  

Keo hopes to send her children to school through at least high school.  Her family is very grateful to all lenders.  This is her first loan from Kiva and HKL.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Tessie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Tessie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosa has a food shop or "carenderia" that sells viands like chicken & pork "adobo" & "halang-halang". She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking viands to sell.

Rosa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking viands to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Norma has a retail shop that sells canned goods,snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Norma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Norma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Flordelisa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads.

Flordelisa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Flordelisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Juanita has a retail shop. She buys & sells vegetables like spring onions, ginger, & garlic. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Juanita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juanita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Liezyl

texts.en:
Liezyl is married with two children. Liezyl is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines.

She is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase fertilizer for the rice plantation. 

Liezyl has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Liezyl hopes to send her children to school and finish a college degree.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice plantation.

loans.name: Natewo Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya!  Pamela is the facilitator of the Natewo SHG group. Pamela and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Pamela takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Pamela will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.


In 2012, the members of Natewo SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.  On the far left of the this photo, the Natewo field officer holds a One Acre fund sign.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated.
 
Josephine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Saydjamol

texts.ru: Сайджамол проживает в районе Восеъ. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается развозками. Кроме того он предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Saydjamol lives in the Vose district.  He is 53 years old, married and has seven children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Saydjamol is involved in transportation.  Besides this, he also provides a taxi service.  He has been in this business for six years.  Saydjamol is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

Carmela has a food  shop that sells snacks like ice-flavored salad  or "halo-halo". She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Carmela is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Carmela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Benilda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & rice per kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Benilda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Benilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is widow with six children. She is 64 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Rebecca wants to purchase additional products such as canned goods, toiletries, etc. for her general store. She does this to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. She has requested  a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Rebecca hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Marly

texts.en:
Marly is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with fpur children. 

Marly is providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for  gasoline and maintenance.

Marly is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Regina  Group

texts.en:
Regina is 45 years old and lives in Senor, Sinaaacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Regina has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Regina has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Regina has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Regina would like to send her children to school and finish a college degree.

Regina is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Rhea Catherine

texts.en:
Rhea Catherine is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Rhea Catherine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She also buys and sells chickens like "cal" chicken or white leghorn chicken. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages  to sell.

Rhea Catherine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rhea Catherine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Simon Likhola

texts.en:
Simon is a 34-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 12 years. He describes himself as visionary. He operates a pool table business where he rents out pool tables and sells CDs and DVDs. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. 

Simon describes his biggest business challenges to be inflation and seasonality. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase one more pool table. His business goal is to find a permanent place for his business and to open a big pool hall within five years.

loans.use: To purchase an additional pool table for his business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is married with three children. She is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines

Angelita is a farmer and grows  corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase corn seeds to raise. 

Angelita has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Angelita hopes to send her children to school to finish a college degree.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds to raise.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Evangelina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Evangelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Evangelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Fernando Group

texts.en:
Fernando is widowed with four children. He is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Fernando is a farmer and grows  corn to earn a living. He has been doing this for 26 years. He has requested a loan of 9000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for the corn plantation. 

Fernando has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Fernando hopes to send his children to school.

Fernando is the leader of a 3-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is married with four children.  She is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Bernadeth is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 22 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase fertilizer for the corn.

Bernadeth has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Bernadeth hopes to purchase fertilizer for her corn.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Grace has a food shop that sells pork & chicken barbecue. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making barbecue.

Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making barbecue.

loans.name: Elizabeth Atieno

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has a son. She describes herself as motivated, loving, and kind. She operates a retail shop where she sells general household goods, such as milk, bread, sugar, cooking oil, paraffin and soap. She has been involved in this business for one year and employs one staff member. Her business is located in the local market. 

Elizabeth describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough working capital to purchase stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase stock such as bread, milk, paraffin, salad and detergent. Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop to serve traders and shopkeepers within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase more stock, including bread, milk, paraffin, salad and detergent.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with three children. She is 51 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Fe sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients for snack-making.

Fe has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her family's house.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for snack-making.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Emelyn has a retail shop that sells vegetables like cabbages, carrots & potatoes. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Emelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Emelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina, age 50, lives in her own home with her family. Josefina makes and sells banana chips. She has had this business for several years, and thanks to God she has done well. 

For Josefina, it is very important to keep her business going, since it is her main source of income. Thanks to her hard work and kindness, she has been able to establish a good customer base, which is expanding every day. Her customers prefer her because she is charismatic, and she always has delicious banana chips. 

 She hopes to be able to achieve her goal and to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cooking oil and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Marina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & vegetable like sayote. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables for sell.

Marina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина жительница района Дангары. Ей 24 года. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. У нее имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности она портниха. В этой области она работает три года. Кредит берет для покупки цветных ниток, пуговиц, бисера и однотонных материалов.
texts.en: Parvina lives in the Dangara district.  She is 24 years old and single.  She lives together with her parents.  Parvina has a secondary specialized education.  She is a seamstress.  She has been working in this field for three years.  Parvina is requesting this loan for the purchase of color threads, buttons, beads and solid-color fabrics.

loans.use: to buy color threads, buttons, beads and solid-color fabrics

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Julieta has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Julieta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Juliet has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & rice per kilograms. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & rice to sell.

Juliet is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & rice to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a resident of and a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. He is aged 45 and married with three children in school, aged 17, 13 and 10. He has been in mixed farming for 10 years and currently employs two farmhands. His farm produces tomatoes, cabbages, maize, milk and eggs, which all go to the local market.

Daniel has requested a loan of 47,250 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy cow will help improve his income and enable him to improve his family's living standards, educate the children and expand his crop farming.

He laments the low market prices for farm products but commends Juhudi Kilimo for being reliable.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
