Shella has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Shella is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Shella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Baby Lee

texts.en:
Baby Lee is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Baby Lee has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Baby Lee is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Baby Lee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and a single-mother of a 12-year-old.  

She has been operating a hardware store for three years.  She also practices livestock farming to supplement her income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Grace has been able to improve her business income with her previous loans.

Grace has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy cows and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy cows and animal feed.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Arlene has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from AVON & NATASHA. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing products from AVON & NATASHA to sell.

Arlene is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing products from AVON & NATASHA to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries for the shop

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Mary Grace has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Mary Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheels, a chain and gasoline for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol with her family. She has had a fish selling business for five years. Anabella buys directly from fishermen in her town. She also buys and resells other seafood like squid and shrimp.

Anabella has requested this loan to buy a weighing scale, fish and squid to sell. She hopes for this loan to help her business grow.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale, fish and squid to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Esperanza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Esperanza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Esperanza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Leonila has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Leonila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leonila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 37 years old and married. They have two school-going children. Susan has been practicing farming for the last five years in Kimende.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. She paid the other loan well and in good time. She intends to use the loan amount to open a  selling premises and cultivate and buy seeds.

In the future, she hopes to provide fully for her family and expand her farming practice.

loans.use: To open a selling premises and buy seeds

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 49 years old and married. She has two children who are 11 and 12 years old. Claudia's husband works as a boatman.

Claudia makes bread for a living. She uses a traditional oven and makes bread at the back of her house. Claudia sells her products to store owners in her town. She plans to use her loan to purchase an oven and ingredients such as flour and sugar. She hopes to have her own bakery shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and ingredients such as flour and sugar

loans.name: Ashley Jane

texts.en:
Ashley Jane is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.
 
Ashley Jane has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ashley Jane is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ashley Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a housewife who does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is very active and performs her duties very well. 

Her husband operates a grocery shop in the market where he sells different household items such as sugar, spices, cooking oil, etc. His rates are very reasonable. That’s why he attracts a good number of clients every day. 

Shamim is a mother of two sons. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk, which will allow him to offer more variety to his customers and increase his sales and profits. He is very experienced in his business and Shamim is very hopeful that an investment will help him make more profits by selling a larger quantity of groceries to his customers.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Esterlita Group

texts.en:
Esterlita is married with three children. Esterlita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Esterlita is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 18 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizer for her corn. 

Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her house.

Esterlita is the leader of a three-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her corn

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Melinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & bananas. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & bananas to sell.

Melinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Melinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & bananas to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 45 years old. She is a single mother of two school-going children. She operates a salon in Nairobi. She has been in the business for the past 23 years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This is her first loan. She will use the amount to buy two dryers and two steamers. In the future, she aspires to open another salon in Westlands.

loans.use: To buy two dryers and two steamers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en: Eleuteria is a 64-year-old married woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She makes banana and camote (sweet potato) cue. Eleuteria sells her products to schools in her town. She requested this loan to buy flour, more bananas and more sweet potatoes. Eleuteria hopes to have her own food stall in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, bananas and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children who are between two and eight years old. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a tailoring business where she provides a dressmaking service and sells material. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenges to be seasonality and inflation. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase materials. Her business goal is to expand her business into wholesale within five years.

loans.use: To purchase materials (fabrics)

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Rolando provides karaoke or videoke where customers pay five pesos per song. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to pay for the electricity for maintenance.

Rolando is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rolando hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for electricity

loans.name: Arise And Shine Group

texts.en:
Simbarashe lives in Masvingo. He is 37 years old, married and has four children who are 3, 5, 8 and 10 years old. Two of his children are attending school.

Simbarashe is a carpenter. He makes coffins, wardrobes and kitchen units. He has been in this business for 10 years. The challenge he faces is that when clients are financially constrained, they normally concentrate on food and rarely buy furniture.

The amount of USD 400 he has applied for is going towards the purchase of timber. With extra income obtained from his business, Simbarashe will buy food and pay school fees for his children.

In the near future, Simbarashe plans to open a hardware shop.

loans.use: To buy timber to make coffins, wardrobes and kitchen units

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly is 38 years old and married. She has three children who are 18, 16 and 10 years old. Jolly and her husband have been running a fishing business for 10 years. Jolly's husband is a fisherman and is the one who operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Jolly sells her husband's catch at the market. Jolly plans to use her loan to buy nets, hooks and other fishing gear. This will help Jolly and her husband continue earning from their business.

loans.use: to buy nets, hooks and other fishing gear

loans.name: Abselmina

texts.en:
Abselmina is widowed with no children. Abselmina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Abselmina is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to purchase fertilizer for her rice plantation.

Abselmina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Abselmina hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mouy

texts.en: Mouy, 57, resides with her husband and one kid in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. Mouy sells fish for an income of around USD 4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. Mouy is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her kid to commute to work. With the remainder of the loan, she wants to purchase more fish to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her kid to commute to work

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.en:
Cerilo is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Cerilo has a shop that sells coconut & wood charcoal by the sack. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconut shells and wood for charcoal making.

Cerilo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cerilo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells and wood to make charcoal

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a 61 year-old villager who has been living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. 

His profession in cultivating rice crops in rainy and dry seasons with his wife, who always helps him. This couple usually receives an average of $2.40 each day to cover all expenses. 

Chan and his wife are blessed with four children, two of whom are single and the other two have already married and have new homes.  

One of their daughters is a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh.  Every day, she must walk or hire a motor taxi service to get to work, and she always spends too much money to travel.  Chan has decided to borrow some funds from Kiva to purchase a second hand motorcycle for his daughter. 

In the future, Chan wishes to buy a plowing machine and rebuild his old house.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand motorcycle for her daughter.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 42 years old, married and has four children who are in school.  

For over ten years, he has operated a green grocery store.  He also grows coffee and rears goats for extra income.  Previously, he sold charcoal.

Bernard is a new member of Faulu Kenya, but he has become more business oriented through ideas he's shared with his group members.  

He has requested a 20,000 Kenya shilling loan to start a poultry farming business.

loans.use: To start poultry farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport recyclable material to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed.
 
Lolita has a tailoring shop where she makes & sells school & office uniforms. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy cloth for dressmaking.

Lolita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth for dressmaking

loans.name: Sreyveoun

texts.en:
Sreyveoun, 25, resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sreyveoun is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of $4 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $4 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. 
Each month, the family has to spend $30 USD on food and $30 USD on other necessary expenses. Sreyveoun is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to work at the garment factory. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Marcela has a retail shop that sells canned goods and snacks such as fruit and milk shakes. She has run this business for 29 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making fruit shakes.
Marcela is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making fruit shakes.

loans.name: Sarah Makonjo

texts.en:
Sarah is a 37-year-old married woman. She has five children aged between 10 and 20 years old. She describes herself as a visionary. She operates a grocery store where she sells cereal, maize, beans, peas and groundnuts. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenges to be seasonality, inflation, and the low purchasing power of her customers. 
Sarah will use this loan of 80,000 KES to purchase cereal. Her business goal is to buy a pick-up vehicle for transporting cereal within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand her business into wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase more cereal.

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean, 57, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Mean is a farmer, earning an income of $3 USD per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $4 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $40 USD on food and $50 USD on other necessary expenses. 
Mean is requesting a loan of $300 USD to purchase a new motorbike with a tuk-tuk (auto rickshaw) to improve her husband’s transportation business. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike with a tuk-tuk to improve her husband's  transportation business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya where she has practiced farming for over 10 years.  She is 51 years old and married with four children: ages nine through 29.  Three are in school.  Her farm produces eggs and vegetables for the local market.

Mary has made a loan request of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry business, by buying more birds.  This is her third loan with Juhudi Kilimo and says she has confidence that her business will grow, due to her experience.  Mary indicates that diseases remain a challenge in the farming business.

Her first and second loans of 20,000 KES and 40,000 KES were promptly paid.  Mary says the income will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Arcelie has a retail shop that buys and sells coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat). She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy coconuts for copra.
Arcelie is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra.

loans.name: Toloso A Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is the facilitator of the Toloso group. Everlyne and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Everlyne  takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Everlyne will invest in raising livestock and buy more land as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Toloso A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the picture above, all Toloso group members are present, although group member Victorious is being represented by his wife.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Caroline Naliaka

texts.en:
Caroline is a 29-year-old married woman. She has a daughter who is five years old. She describes herself as a visionary. 
Caroline operates a salon where she weaves and braids hair and sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a shopping center and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenges to be inflation and seasonality. 
Caroline will use this 20,000 KES loan to purchase cosmetics. Her business goal is to have opened another salon in the next shopping center within five years.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, 33, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sophal sells groceries, earning an income of $5 USD per day. Her husband is a local police officer, earning an income of $3.5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. 
Each month, the family has to spend $50 USD on food and $25 USD on other necessary expenses. Sophal is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more groceries items to stock her store. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to stock her store.

loans.name: Mukai Group

texts.en:
Enesta is 59 years old and lives in Gweru. Her husband does not work and they have four children, all of whom have finished school. They care for three further dependents.
Enesta rears and sells chickens and has been doing so for 20 years. She has four employees. An irregular power supply can make it hard to keep the young chicks warm. She supplements her income by growing and selling vegetables.
Enesta will invest the money that she borrows by purchasing additional chicks and heating equipment. She hopes that her business will continue to expand and that she will be able to buy her own truck to supply a wide range of shops.

loans.use: to buy chicks and heating equipment.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel, a 43-year-old married father of five, lives in Lower Lodiong, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur, where he has operated a general store for almost three  years. Having joined PMPC this year, he is requesting a loan for 6000 to purchase more stocks for his general store. In the future, Daniel hopes that he can improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for his general store.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated and has seven children. 

Rolando is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for one year. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools for motorcycle maintenance and pay for gasoline.

Rolando is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rolando hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and tools for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Pola

texts.en:
Pola, 55, is a married lady blessed with children who are all grown up. She operates a local retail shop in the Kadhuhuni section of Malindi town. The business has been in existence for the past ten years now, and Pola usually earns a monthly income of about KES 9,800 from it. 

Pola has been loaned KES 50,000 by KADET Ltd. and this serves as her fourth loan cycle from the company. She intends to use her loan to buy items such as cooking flour, soft drinks, cooking oil, toothpastes and sweets for children so as to add to the stock that she already has. 

The lady wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue supporting her family as well as continue restocking and gradually expanding her business so as to continue helping her family to upgrade their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is a hard-working and conscientious person. She is married to the loving father of her three children.  One is married and lives in a separate house.  The other two living with Mao. 

Presently, she and her humble husband generate a living as rice cultivators, in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia.  They learned this skill from their ancestors.  Both have been involved in their business since 1981.  They earn approximately $5 for each day to support their family.

Mao wishes to purchase farmland but lacks some capital, so she has decided to request funds through HKL, a Kiva partner.  

Mao is expecting that, through this loan her family will gain more happiness, prosperity and profit.  Mao is grateful to all in advance for their help and support.  She is shown with her loving husband.

loans.use: to purchase a farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children.
 
Ricardo provides Internet and computer games where customers spend a single peso per minute. He has had this business for six years. 

He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for electricity and for maintenance.

Ricardo is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ricardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for electricity and for maintenance.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath, 28, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

Sambath is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a fisherman and farmer, earning an income of USD 8 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 15 on the other necessary expenses. 

Sambath is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a 28-year-old married man. He has a son. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a grocery store. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a densely populated area. He says his biggest business challenges are inadequate security and environmental risks. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to restock the grocery store. His business goal is to open a wholesale store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to diversify into the cereal supply business.

loans.use: To restock the grocery store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has been practicing livestock farming for the last 10 years in Limuru town. He is 37 years old married to Dorcas. They have two schooling children.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET client. He repaid his other loans well and in good time. He intends to use this loan to buy a cow and expand the agriculture sector.

In the future he hopes to become a successful farmer and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a cow and expand the agriculture sector.

loans.name: Ümmügülsüm

texts.en:
Ümmü is married and has one 15-year-old child. 

Before she began to sell jewelry, she was a housewife. But when her sister went to Mardin, they decided to sell the jewelry of Mardin in Istanbul. So her sister began to send jewelry to Istanbul and helped Ümmü to buy a shop.  

Now, Ümmü is selling the jewelry coming from Mardin in her shop.  

Ümmü wants to use her loan from Maya to sell more products. She thinks that if she buys different kinds of jewelry with the loan, she will be able to appeal to more customers.  

In the future, she wants to be known around Eskişehir for her jewelry from Mardin.  

Finally, Ümmü is a very ambitious and resolute woman, and her son is the most valuable person in her life.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Ümmü Hanım, evli ve 15 yaşında bir çocuğu var.  Bu işe başlaman önce ev hanımıydı.Fakat ablasının Mardin'e tahininin çıkması ile ,Mardin takılarını İstanbul'da satmaya karar verdi.  Bu yüzden ablası takıları İstanbul'a göndermeye başladı ve ona dükkan tutuldu.  Şimdi Ümmü Mardin'den gelen takıları dükkanında satıyor.  Ümmü Maya'dan aldığı bu kredi ile daha fazla ürün satmak istiyor.  Maya'dan almış olduğum kredi ile farklı takılar alırsam, satışımın artacağına inanıyorum.  Gelecek için planları ise,Eskişehirde Mardin yöresel takılarıyla tanınmak.  Ümmü Hanım,istikrarlı ve hırslı bir kadın,oğlu onun için bu hayattaki en kıymetli şey.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of jewelry.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has four children.
 
Noel has a shop that makes and sells coconut and wood charcoal by the sack. He has had this business for 10 years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconut and wood for charcoal making.

Noel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Noel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconut and wood for charcoal making.

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is a 29-year-old fisherman living in Panglao, Bohol. Lito works hard to support his family of a wife and three children.

He is asking for a loan to purchase a boat engine and fish nets, which will help him continue running his fishing business.

In the future, Lito hopes to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase boat engine and fish nets.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
 
Rebecca has a retail shop that sells vegetables like onions and garlic. She has had this business for one year. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rebecca is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase radios and clothing for sale

loans.name: Saerahon's Group

texts.en:
Saerahon is the leader of this group. She is 27 and married to a construction worker, who works in Russia. She brings up a son and two daughters. The son studies at school and the daughters are preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn a livelihood, Saerahon breeds livestock and resells them at a higher price after being fattened. In this way she earns about 4,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, Saerahon wants to increase the number of livestock. She plans to purchase three sheep for breeding, fattening and reselling. 

In the future, she is going to start building a shed to keep livestock there.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Helen has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Helen is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang resides in Kampongcham province with a grandson. She sells groceries and earns 11 USD per day. Every month, Heang has to spend 83 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 15 USD on her grandson’s school fee. She would like to request a loan of 500 USD to buy grocery goods to sell in her small store. She doesn’t want to change her career at all because she can make a good profit from it. Heang plans to extend her shop when she has enough money.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 40-year-old, hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. 

For the last 12 years, Thomas has been selling scrap metals and plastic containers for recycling. He has boosted this business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. He also rents houses for more income. Previously, he used to run a retail shop. His dream is to buy a piece of land and build a home. Thomas is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy scrap metals for recycling.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, age 47, is a resident farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. She is married with three adult children. She has been farming for 15 years producing maize, potatoes, carrots, tea, and milk, and selling all to the local market. She also runs a retail business selling cereals in the local market. Grace notes poor market for products is the challenge in farming. 

Grace has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva partner, to help venture into poultry farming. She says the venture into poultry will spread her risk, improve her farming income, and enable her to meet basic needs with ease. She aspires to own rental houses in future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Paul Kuria

texts.en: Paul is a 26-year-old married man. He describes himself as being focused and determined to achieve his goals in life. He operates a workshop where he produces sofa sets, beds and cupboards. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. He describes his biggest business challenges to be lack of capital to buy materials and theft. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more materials, such as timber. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to open a technical training college for carpentry.

loans.use: To purchase more materials, such as timber

loans.name: Ory

texts.en: Ory lives in Kampongcham province with her family, and she and her husband earn about $7 a day by selling food. The couple has two children, both of whom attend school. Every month, Ory and her husband spend $85 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $10 on other items. She is applying for a loan for $600 to buy a motorbike to use to carry the food she and her husband sell. Their goal is to earn an income that's large enough to care for their family and educate their children through at least high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for transporting food.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 57 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are employed as professionals. She earns a living by running a general store and by making dresses and providing tailoring services. She has been in this line of work for almost 10 years, thanks in part to the fact that her husband manages her store when she is busy making dresses. She is applying for a loan for PHP 35,000 to buy more groceries to sell in her store, where sales have been very high lately because it is located along a busy road. She will use the loan to buy canned goods, eggs, oil, soft drinks, milk, sugar, shampoo, instant noodles and ingredients needed for cooking. She hopes that his loan will allow her to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy buy items to sell in a general store.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann, a 28-year-old married mother of two children, lives in the Philippines where she has a retail shop that sells clothing from Natasha & Avon. In this this business for six years, she recently became a member of HSPFI and is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more clothing products from her suppliers.

In the future, Joann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing products from Natasha & Avon.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun, who is 43 years old, resides in Kampongcham province with her family.  She and her husband work in a factory and earn $9 a day. She has three children, one of whom is in school. Their second child earns $2.50 a day by repairing motorbikes and their third child earns $2.50 a day as an artist. Every month, Oun spends $70 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy equipment for her son so that he can open his own shop for repairing motorbikes. If all goes well, their son plans to expand his income by enlarging his shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy equipment for their son to start a new career.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en: Mira is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she is married and has three children. She earns a living by running a shop where she sells clothing and beauty products from firms such as Natasha and Avon. She has been in this business for six years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Mira is a new member of HSPFI and has joined in the hope of improving her business.

loans.use: to buy more Avon and Natasha beauty items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fils

texts.fr:
Fils est né au Rwanda et il a 25 ans. Il est marié avec 1 enfant de 1 an et 7 mois. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Fils est transporteur (il a un taxi moto). C’est son quatrième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter une moto pour son business. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter les nombres des motos utilisées pour augmenter la capacité.
Dans les prochaines années, Fils voudrait acheter des voitures utilisées comme taxi et devenir. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’aider sa famille de se développer et la soigner.
texts.en:
Fils was born in Rwanda and he is 25 years old. He is married with 1 child aged 1year and 7 months. His education reached the 6th year of primary school.
Fils is a driver (he has a motorcycle taxi) this is his fourth loan with ACB.He is going to use his credit to buy a motorbike for his business.
His strategy for the growth of his business is to increase the number of motorbikes to increase his capacity.
In the next few years, Fils would like to buy cars to use as taxis and become a taxi driver. With the profits, he plans to help his family to develop and look after them.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his business.

loans.name: Sreyvart

texts.en: Srey Vart is 24 years old and lives in Kampongcham province with her family. She earns $2 a day by selling groceries, while her husband earns $5 a day working for a non-governmental organization. They have a child who is one year old. Every month, she spends $83 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on transportation and $10 on other items. She is applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use when traveling to and from work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to use when commuting.

loans.name: Exodus Romac Group

texts.en:
Grace is 50 years old and lives in Gweru. She has six children, one of whom is still at school. Grace's husband buys and sells a variety of items and Grace rears and sells chickens, a business she has been running for four years. She faces problems with the cold killing small chicks and has suffered theft.
Grace will invest the money that she borrows by extending the chicken coop and buying more chicks. She hopes that her business will continue to provide her family with a good life and an improved diet.

loans.use: to buy chicks and building materials to extend chicken run.

loans.name: Nilufar's Group

texts.en:
Nilufar is the leader of this group. She is 28 and married to a constructor. Her husband used to work as a teacher, but because of his low salary he left that job. Together the couple brings up a daughter and a son. Three years ago, the family saved 12,000 soms and with that money they purchased livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. With the profits gained, Nilufar was able to repair the house. At the moment, she needs additional funds to purchase three sheep for breeding. In the near future, she plans to put up iron gates at home. Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from MBF staff..

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 23-year-old married businesswoman.  For the last one year, she has been selling milk to earn a living.  She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  In the next 5 years, she wants to become a major distributor of milk in her region. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy milk.

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Aggrey W.

texts.en: Aggrey is a 37-year-old married man. He has three children aged between 2 and 11. He describes himself as focused and determined to fight poverty. He operates a dressmaking business. He has been involved in this business for ten years and employs one staff member. Aggrey describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to buy materials and more machines, which sometimes makes it impossible to deliver clothes on time. He will use the loan of 20,000 KES to purchase an embroidery machine and more materials. His business goal is to design clothes for the public and operate a wholesale business within five years. Aggrey hopes that, in the future, he will be able to offer job opportunities to fellow Kenyans by having a big tailoring company.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and more materials.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng is 27 years old, married, and has one child who attends school.  She resides in Kampongcham province with her family. She sells fruit at the market earning $5 per day. Her husband is goldsmith earning $6 per day. Every month, Sokheng has to spend $35 on food, $2 electricity, $20 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

Sokheng is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to commute to sell fruit. The family did not want to change their careers because they can earn a good profit from it. Sokheng wants to support her child to study in the university when the child finishes high school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to sell fruit.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old, separated, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines. Gina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and  beverages . She has had this business for 26 years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Gina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and  beverages.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 45 years of age, and lives in Culo, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with five children.
Fe has a duckery business, and she also earns from farming. She had this business for more than three years. Fe requested a loan amount of five thousand pesos to purchase fertilizers for her farm and feed for her ducks.
Fe has been joined PMPC this year. In the future, Fe hopes that she can earn more than she needs from her business and from the financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farm and feed for her ducks.

loans.name: C9633 Abavandimwe Group

texts.en:
Savini is 49 years old, and is married with three children aged between 6 and 15 years old. He is the president of a group called “ABAVANDIMWE” in local language which means "THE BROTHERS" in English. In the photo, he is the first man in the black sweater, first line, from the right side. 

Savini owns a business selling Irish potatoes. His business is open from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on Sunday. He currently employs two people to help him. This is his 20th successful year in his business. 

Savini and his group will use this loan to expand their Irish potato business. With any profits, Savini and his group said they would like to provide food for their families, pay school fees for their children, save money for the future, and Savini will be able to buy a goat.

loans.use: To expand his Irish potato business.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 34 years old and has a fish selling business. This business has been running for two years.

Ma. Luisa buys directly from fishermen in her town. She then goes around her community to sell fish. She requested this loan to purchase an ice box, a weighing scale, and more fish to sell. Ma. Luisa hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an ice box, a weighing scale, and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, a 33-year-old mother of three, two of whom are in school, while the third is just three years old, resides in Takeo Province with her family. Sokha is a cake seller earning $5 per day, while her husband, a motor taxi driver, earns $10 per day. Every month, she has to spend $42 on food, $2 on electricity, $5 on school fee, $5 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses.

Sokha is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a Tok Tok in order to offer Tok Tok (taxi) service in Phnom Penh. This loan will help her husband start a new career that can earn more income for the family, part of which she wants to use re-build her house to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a Tok Tok (taxi carriage).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens, vaccines and chicken feed

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Lyn has a retail shop that sells dried fish, beauty products and homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Lyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas in 48 and the father of 3 children aged 18, 12 and 7. He has been in farming for 5 years in his home area of Nkubu in Central Kenya. His farm produces beans, bananas, and milk, all sold at the local market. Silas says that currently, the rains are not sufficient for farming. 

Silas has made a loan request of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his dairy farming by purchasing a dairy cow. This is his third loan with Juhudi Kilimo after the first and second one of 25,000 KES and 20,000 KES respectively. He says the loan will help him acquire a better and more productive breed. He adds that he will use the income to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking businessman aged 44. He is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last two years, he has been operating a van transport business to earn a living.  He also practices poultry farming.  Previously, he used to sell clothes.  In the next 5 years, he wants to become successful in his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy tires for his van.

loans.use: To buy tires for his van

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is 26 years old and is a married woman with 2 young children aged 3 months and 7 years. Ma. Victoria makes banana and camote (sweet potato) cue (deep-fried banana or sweet potato kebabs covered with caramelized brown sugar) for the people in her community. She has had her business for 2 years.

She requested this loan to buy a cooking pan and ingredients such as oil, bananas, sugar and sweet potatoes. Ma. Victoria hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cooking pan and ingredients such as oil, bananas, sugar and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Jypargul's Group

texts.en: Jypargul is the leader of this group. She is 34 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she is bringing up five children, all of whom study at school. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, Jypargul started to take orders to sew Kyrgyz national pillows and blankets. At the moment her business runs well and she earns about 10,000 soms per month. Jypargul applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase fabrics and materials which are needed for sewing. In the future she dreams to show her products in foreign countries. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Wakoritho Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her late 20s, is married with one child who goes to school. She has been running a beauty salon since 2007.  She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a dryer, salon equipment and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to open another salon.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Wakoritho", which has 25 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment

loans.name: Bai Cheryl Lynn

texts.en:
Bai Cheryl Lynn, a 49-year-old married mother of three, lives in the Philippines where she has a food shop that makes and sells chicken and beef sausage. In business for five years and a new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients to make more chicken and beef sausage.

In the future, Bai Cheryl Lynn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making chicken & beef sausage.

loans.name: Green Pastures Group

texts.en:
Judeth is 42 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She also cares for one dependent. Judeth is from Masvingo, Zimbabwe.. 

Judeth runs a clothing business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for three years. The main challenge she faces is the lack of sufficient working capital. 

Judeth is requesting a loan of $400 to buy material to make school uniforms for sale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to pay school fees and buy food for her family. In the future, Judeth plans to open a clothing factory.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials for school uniforms.

loans.name: Ave-Gnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AVE-GNON est formé de trois  personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Viviane, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Viviane est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Paul. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Viviane et sa famille habitent ensemble. Viviane n’a pas été à l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Viviane prépare de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Viviane achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. La clientèle de Viviane devient de plus en plus grande, et Viviane désir rehausser un peu plus le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à leurs exigences. Pour ce faire, et ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de réaliser son rêve, Viviane et les autres membres du groupe AVE-GNON se sont rapprochés de AILDé, en vue d’un autre crédit.
texts.en:
AVE-GNON Group is made up off three women who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, named Viviane, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

This is the first time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Viviane, age 43, is married to a driver named Paul. The couple has four school-attending children to support. Viviane and her family live together. She never attended school.

To provide for herself and her family, she prepares food (rice, corn paste) that she sells at her home. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's town. Her clientele is increasing, and Viviane wants to bolster her business in order to better meet customer demand.

Lacking financial means to make their dream come true, Viviane and the other members of the group approached ALIDé in order to seek a loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Vibula Group

texts.en:
Rajabu, who is in his early 30s, is a married father of three children, two of whom go to school. Rajabu has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2010. He works from 8 a.m to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania with which he will buy more fruits and vegetables. His dream is to have a food shop which will help him to make good profit and enable him to take care of himself and his family.

Rajabu will share this loan with his loan group " Vibura," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase his stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a hardworking businesswoman aged 43. She is single and blessed with three children. For the last three years, she has been managing a beauty salon to earn a living. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a blow dry machine and make up.

loans.use: To buy a blow dry machine and make up

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy, 39, has been operating a fish-selling business for six years. Arising early each day to buy fresh fish from fishermen in town, she is able to meet her family's basic needs through her business. Now requesting this loan to buy more fish to sell, Nancy hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Chiose

texts.en:
Chiose is 46 years old and single.  She lives in the Philippines. Chiose buys and sells pillows, curtains, and bed sheets. She has had this business for 20 years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy home products such as pillows and curtains.

Chiose is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Chiose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase home products such as pillows and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his shop inventory.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Rim is 59 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom works.  She resides in Siem Reap province, an area full of ancient temples. She is a farmer earning $2 per day. her husband is a farmer and fisherman earning $3 per day. Every month, Rim spends $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

Rim is requesting a loan of $500 to buy wood and zinc to build a small shop for her child to do hair dressing and tailoring. She hopes this new career will help her children to earn some income to support themselves.

loans.use: to purchase wood and zinc to build a small hairdressing and tailoring shop.

loans.name: Özlem

texts.en:
Özlem, married and working as a chef for two years, was previously a housewife who was struggling financially. A very ambitious and consistent woman, she decided to learn how to cook and bake from his husband.

Ozlem is now requesting a loan from Maya to take a cooking course to improve her culinary skills. She will then be a master cook, in demand by many restaurants. Ozlem's future plan is to open her own bakery in order to support her family financially. Her family is of paramount importance in her life, and all of her efforts are directed toward supplying them, especially her children, with a good life.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Özlem Hanım evli ve iki yıldır şef olarak çalışıyor. Bu işe başlamadan önce ev hanımıydı ve maddi sorunlar yaşıyordu. Bu yüzden, yemek ve pasta ustası olan eşimden işi öğrenmeye kara verdim ve başladım. Maya'dan aldığım kredi ile kurslara ve seminerlere katılarak, kendimi daha fazla geliştirmek istiyorum. Maya'dan almış olduğum kredi, ustalığımda ilerlememe ve aranılan bir usta olmamı sağlayacak. Gelecek için planlarım ise kendimi çok fazla geliştirip aranılan bir usta olmak istiyorum, daha sonrası ise kendime ait küçük bir pastane açıp çocuklarm ve eşime her anlamda faydalı olmayı planlıyorum. Biliyorumki benim bu planlarımı hayata geçirmek için Maya'nın her zaman yanımda bana büyük desteği olacaktır. Ailem benim için çok önemlidir benim bütün bu çabalarım ise çocukları daha iyi şartlarda yaşatabilmek ve okutabilmek için.

loans.use: to take a courser to improve her cooking skills.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a married woman with 2 children. She is 45 years old and has had a sari-sari store (convenience store) for 10 years.

Sylvia sells items such as canned goods, coffee, and shampoo to the people in her community. She is able to provide for her family's daily needs through her business.

Sylvia is requesting a loan of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more items to sell such as rice, canned goods, and soft drinks. In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as rice, canned goods, and soft drinks

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Jocelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells rice grains by the kilogram. She has had this business for 20 years.  She has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more rice for resale.

Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale

loans.name: Nerng

texts.en:
Nerng, who is 39 years old, resides in the province of Siem Reap, an area full of ancient temples. She is a working for a tourism company and earns $5 year old. She lives with two nephews and two nieces. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food and $10 on other expenses.

Nerng would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her niece to travel to sell souvenirs. Nerng used to sell souvenirs near the temple, but she got two nieces to help her with the sales so she can work to earn more income. She wants to repair her house and establish one more souvenir shop for her niece so that her niece can have their own career.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her niece to travel to sell souvenirs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Elvira has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish & rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of dried fish & rice for sell.

Elvira is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish & rice to stock and sell.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 31 year old, resides in Siem Reap province, an area full of ancient temples. She is a housewife. and her husband is a soldier earning $4.50 per day. She has two children, and both of them are in school. Every month she has to spend $60 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. 

Pov would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a motorbike to transport watermelons to sell. This loan will help Pov to have a new career that can earn some money for her living expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport watermelons to sell.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en: Jacklyne, age 30, is a businesswoman. She is married and blessed with one child. For the last eight years, she has been doing some tailoring work. She also operates a boutique and she owns rental houses which earn her extra income. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 95,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Teofanes

texts.en:
Teofanes is a 41-year-old married woman who has a fish selling business in Panglao, Bohol. This business has been running for 10 years.

Teofanes buys the fish she sells from fishermen in her town. She works hard to improve her income and support her family. She requested this loan to buy an ice box, a weighing scale, and more fish to sell. Teofanes hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an ice box, a weighing scale and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some materials for decorating her house.

loans.name: Sel

texts.en:
Sel, 30 year old, resides in Siem Reap province, an area full of ancient temples. She is a grocery seller at home and earns $5 per day. Her husband is working in a company and earns $4 per day. She has four children; one is studying and the other three are too small for school. 

Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy more grocery goods to sell. This loan will help her family to buy more kinds of goods to sell in her store for her customer’s needs.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Eloisa has a retail shop that sells dried fish where she makes and sells home-made sausage or "longganisa". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making home-made sausage.

Eloisa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Eloisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for home-made sausage.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a farmer in Nkubu area, Central Kenya. His farm produces potatoes, onions and cabbages which he sells to the local market. He has two farmhands on a casual basis, and he has been in business for five years. He is married with two children, ages 10 and 4, who are both in school. Lawrence says animal diseases and insufficient feed are the major limitations in farming. 

Lawrence has requested a loan of 47,250 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will improve his income, which will improve the living conditions of his children by providing for their basic needs – especially their education. Lawrence is pleased with Juhudi's loan services to small-holder farmers.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 47 years old and is married with two grown children. She believes that determination and patience are the keys to success. She engages in a personal-care business selling detergent, soap, and shampoo in her community.

Edna is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more detergent, soap, and shampoo to generate additional income. She dreams of having her own stall someday for displaying her products.

loans.use: to buy detergent, soap, and shampoo for resale

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, who is 30 years old, resides in the province of Siem Reap, an area full of ancient temples. She sells food and drinks and earns $9 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $5 per day. This couple does not have any children yet. Every month, San has to spend $66 on food and $10 on other expenses.

San would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work. She also wants to expand her business to buy more kinds of drinks and to make more kinds of food because now there are many guests visiting the ancient temples.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work

loans.name: 2181 Amizero Group

texts.en:
Gaudance is 38 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 9 years old. She is the president of a group which is called "Amizero" in the local language. The group is composed of three people: two men and one woman. Gaudance is the first person on the right side. She sells fruits and bananas. This business is well-organized.  She works from 6am until 6pm every day, and she has three years of experience. Gaudance employs two people to help her.

Gaudance and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more quantity of fruits and vegetables.  With the resulting profit, Gaudance and her team will be able to save money in the future and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gnek

texts.en:
Gnek, 21 years old, resides in Siem Reap Province, an area full of ancient temples. She sells vegetables, fish and pork and earns $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $5 per day. This couple has one children and he is two years old. 

Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for the use in the family. She wants to repair her house to be better for her family to live in. For her children, she will working hard to support them to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the use in the family.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 27 years old, a married lady blessed with one child. She sells used clothes in Malindi. The lady has been in this business for the past two years now and she earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000 which she uses to support  her small family as well as using some of it to run her business. 

Margaret has applied  for a loan of KES 30,000 through KADET LTD and this serves as her first loan from KADET LTD .She intends to use the loan  amount to buy additional stock of used clothes for sale due to the rise in her clientèle in the region. 

The client wishes to use some of her anticipated profit to continue running her business as well as continue saving a portion of it so as she will be able to run her own boutique in future.

loans.use: To buy additional  stock of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Melita has a food shop where she makes & sells viands like chicken & pork "adobo" & "bulalo". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Melita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Melita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Gnambossou-Gbeta 06 Group

texts.fr: GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 06 est un groupement constitué de quinze personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Pascaline Baï. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Pascaline Baï est âgée de 55 ans et est une veuve. Pascaline Baï a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un est à sa charge. Pascaline Baï vit seule avec son enfant à charge et assure seule ses différents besoins. Pascaline Baï a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant encore à sa charge, Pascaline Baï mène comme activité la vente de bananes plantains dans une ville du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Pascaline Baï vend des volailles. Pascaline Baï exerce cette activité depuis près de trente ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Pascaline Baï s’approvisionne au Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Pascaline Baï et aux autres membres du groupe GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 06, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 06 Group is made up of 15 persons. Its representative, named Pascaline Baï, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. The members of the group live together in the same neighborhood in Benin.

In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Pascaline Baï, age 55, is a widow. She has two children, who both have had schooling. She has to support one and lives alone with him and provides for his various needs on her own.

She didn't attend school much. In order to provide for herself and for the child she has to support, she sells plantains in one of Benin's town. As a secondary business, she also sells poultry.

Pascaline Baï has been running this business for more than 30 years, which enables her to provide for the various expenses of her family. She gets her supplies in Benin.

This first loan will certainly enable Pascaline Baï and the other members of the group to bolster their businesses, and increase their clientele and their income.

loans.use: to buy bunches of plantains

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 41-year-old married man living in Trinidad, Bohol.

Alexander runs a motorcycle taxi business and has had this business for five years. This business earns 4000 PHP per month.

Alexander is asking for a loan to repair his motorcycle. This will help him continue earning from his business. He hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice for her stall at the market.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a 57-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 18 years old.

Apolinaria has been engaged in farming for 30 years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. 

Apolinaria hopes for her business to grow. She also desires to see all her children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Lütfiye

texts.en:
Lütfiye is married and she has two children. The elder one is 22 and the younger one is 16.  She has been dealing with commerce for five years.  Before she got involved in commerce, she was a housewife and she wanted to support her family financially.  So, she joined cooking workshops, especially for Turkish food.  After she had finished the workshops, she opened a little restaurant for Turkish food and breakfast.  

Lütfiye used the credit she got from Maya to improve her restaurant’s physical appearance so that her shop is attracting more customers now.  Her future plan is to open a larger shop in the busiest street in her city and add to her menu “çiğ börek” (a kind of Turkish food).  She is a very ambitious but a modest woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Lütfiye Hanım evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  En büyüğü 22 ve en küçüğü 16 yaşında.  Lütfiye Hanım  beş yıldır ticaret ile uğraşıyor.  Ticarete başlamadan önce ev hanımıydım,artık kendim ve çocuklarım için bişeyler yapmalıydım.  Ev yemekleri kurslarına katıldım, kendimi yeterli gördüğüm zaman küçük bir ev yemekleri ve kahvaltı salonu açmaya karar verdim.  Bu aşamada eşimin desteği çok büyük oldu.Maya'dan aldığım kredi ile iş yerimde eksik gördüğüm bazı değişiklikler yaptım.  Maya'dan almış olduğum kredi ile dükkanımda yaptığım değişiklikler sayesinde müşteri potansiyelimin arttığına inanıyorum.  Gelecek için planlarım ise işlerimi daha fazla büyüterek dükkanımı daha işlek yere taşıyıp çiğ börek işine girmek istiyorum.  Ailem benim için çok önemlidir.  Çocuklarımı yurt dışında okutup daha iyi bir eğitim almalarını sağlamak istiyorum.Hırslı azimli ve çok mütevazi bir kadın.

loans.use: to improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony has been in the transportation industry for the last six years. He operates a motorbike taxi, locally known as bodaboda. He is 27 years old, married and supports three people in his family. 

He learned about KADET LTD, through a staff member of KADET. He has been a good client, thus applies for his second loan which he plan to use to expand his taxi business. He wants to expand from operating a motorbike (bodaboda) and buy a car, which can provide better returns. 

He hopes to generate income and use the income to repay the loan. He dreams to be rich in the future. He is an industrious person who can do more, if provided with resources.

loans.use: to expand his taxi business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
"Touching and knowing the life of the client" is the secret of Lilibeth, 36 years old. She is married and has five children. She would like to have more clients and to invest in her personal collection business of plates, spoons and glasses. She has been engaged in her business for five years.

Lilibeth is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase different products that she can offer to her neighbors. She dreams that someday she will see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy glasses, spoons and plates for her business.

loans.name: Muriungi

texts.en:
Muriungi is 35 and is a father of 2 children aged 8 and 4 years. He lives with his family in their home in Nkubu, Central Kenya. He has been in farming for 4 years and produces maize, potatoes, cabbages and milk for the local market. He currently runs his farm with the help of 3 farmhands, one on a permanent basis with the other two being engaged casually.

He has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will improve his income and enable him to specialize in dairy farming since he is a veterinary officer. He adds he would want to buy an artificial insemination machine from his income in future.

He commends Juhudi Kilimo for the services it offers farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Limus

texts.en:
Limus is a 30 year old man, married to Maureen. Together, they have two children, aged two and five years old. His primary business is carpentry, which gives him KES15,000 monthly.

This is Limus' first loan with KADET LTD. This loan will enable him to buy more raw materials, like timber. He will save his anticipated profits and use them to improve the family`s living standards and to educate his children. 

He hopes to open a furniture show room to sell unique furniture.

loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Yemalin Group

texts.fr: YEMALIN est un  groupement composé de onze personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quarter au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Delphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Delphine est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un certain Casimir. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec eux. Delphine et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Delphine a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Delphine prépare de la nourriture (riz) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Delphine s'approvisionne au Bénin. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Delphine et aux autres membres du groupement YEMALIN de rehausser leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en: YEMALIN is a group made up of eleven people who all live in the same neighbourhood in Benin. It is the second time that this group has requested a loan from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their activity and better answer the demands of their customers. The leader of the group by the name of Delphine is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Delphine is 26 years old and is married to a certain Casimir.They have four children all of whom attend school and live together with their parents. Delphine and her husband manage the different family expenses together. Delphine stopped going to school at primary level. For about fifteen years Delphine has prepared the food (rice) that she sells from home. This activity generates the income that helps her to provide for her children’s needs. Delphine buys her stock in Benin. This loan will undoubtedly enable Delphine and the other members of the YEMALIN group to enhance their activity and increase their sales and their revenue.

loans.use: to buy rice and condiments for sauce.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Judith has a retail shop where she sells hardware products like fluorescent lamps, electrical bubs & solvent like rugby (adhesive). She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock of hardware products.

Judith is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of hardware products.

loans.name: Kirui

texts.en:
Kirui is a very diligent woman who practices farming. She has been in this business for over three years. She is 34 years old and married She and her husband have three children.

She has been a good client and she is applying for her first loan. She plans to use part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 34 years old and lives in Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 4 children. 

Anselma owns a sari sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase groceries like oil, salt, snack foods, shampoo and other items. Anselma has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. 

In the future, Anselma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries like oil, salt, snack foods, shampoo and other items

loans.name: Ok Mufakose Group B
