texts.en:
Maureen is 27 years old and lives in Mufakose. She is married, but as yet they have no children. Both Maureen and her husband sell vegetables at the local market. They have no other source of income. The main issue facing them both is the lack of capital with which to grow their business. She will invest the money she borrows in purchasing more vegetables to sell.

In time, Maureen hopes to run her own vegetable wholesaling business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Sirere

texts.en:
Sirere is 40 years old. He is married and a father of two. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last 4 years. He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence.

This will be Sirere's first loan which he will use to buy wheat seedlings for planting and fertilizer. He hopes to use the profit acquired from the loan to purchase more land for farming, to increase wheat production, and educate his children. 

Sirere hopes to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot. He is a hardworking man who can do more if supported.

loans.use: To prepare his wheat farm

loans.name: Dorinda

texts.en:
Dorinda is 66 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 7 children.

Dorinda works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase 30 kilos of big fish to sell. Dorinda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. 

In the future, Dorinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 30 kilos of big fish to sell

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia's husband has a bamboo supply business. He supplies bamboo to different cities and earns income for the family. Safia herself is a housewife and performs her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is very active person and does her household work with great responsibility. She is the mother of 3 children: 2 of them are studying in a local school. 

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy bamboo in larger quantities to be able to fulfill the demands of his customers and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for the past 20 years and Safia is confident that his business will grow further after the loan investment. 

Note: "One of the members has a clothes selling business, that's why they are holding cloth."

loans.use: to buy bamboo to sell

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en:
Dioscoro is 41 years old and is a married man with three children. The oldest child is 19 years old. Dioscoro makes and sells "tuba" (coconut wine) for a living. He has a coconut farm, which is the source of his coconut wine. Dioscoro works hard to improve his business and support his family.

Dioscoro has requested this loan to purchase containers and other materials. He hopes for his business to grow bigger.

loans.use: to purchase containers and other materials

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is 69 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Adelaida has a food shop, or carenderia, that makes and sells viands like adobo and afritada. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making viands. Adelaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adelaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 42 years old and is the farther of 6 children aged between 14 and 7 years. He has been in active farming for 10 years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk and maize, both of which he sells to the local market.

Edward has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a modern dairy unit (barn) for his dairy cows. He says this will protect his cows and the improved income will be spent on buying more and better breeds so as to boost his family's living standards.

However, he laments of frequent price fluctuations for the farming produce.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie manages her snack house under the name "Josh Canteen." She has had this business for 10 years. According to her, the snack house was formerly operated by her mother. Julie learned to run their business from her mother, who started the snack house but later passed it on to her so that the business will continually operate.

At the moment, she needs to improve her stock of soft drinks, raw vegetables, flour, baking soda, bihon, and ingredients needed in her snack house business. For this, she needs additional working capital amounting to 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) because she's suffering from a shortage of funds. She hopes that she can obtain this loan amount so she can improve their quality of life and save something for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, raw vegetables, flour, baking soda, bihon, and ingredients needed in her snack house business

loans.name: Rajab

texts.ru: Ражаб проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Ражаб предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 20 лет. Кроме того в свободное время он занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для приобретения баллонов и закупа теленка.
texts.en: Rajab lives in the Yavan district.  He is 47 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Rajab provides a taxi service.  He has been involved in this business for 20 years.  Besides this, he is involved in animal husbandry in his spare time.  Rajab is requesting this loan to buy containers and a calf.

loans.use: to buy containers and a calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs and groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 30-year-old married woman with two children who are four and two years old. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Gina primarily grows rice crops to sell. She works hard to help provide for her family's needs.

Gina requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. Gina hopes to have a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 37 years old, married lady blessed with three children. She owns a carpentry business for the past two years. She earns a monthly income of about KES. 40,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Winfred has applied for a loan of KES.30,000 by KADET LTD and this serves as her first loan cycle from the company. The lady intends to use her loan to purchase additional timber, Jack planes, as well as other required items necessary for the business to operate as needed.  


The client wishes to use the anticipated profit from her workshop to continue supporting her family by educating her children as well as save some of it for future investments.

loans.use: to buy more timber  for the  workshop

loans.name: Chemutai

texts.en:
Chemutai is 39 years old. She is married and a mother of five children. She is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last nine years. 

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan which she is planning to spend to buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seedlings.She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent house.

Her dream is to be a prominent farmer of wheat and a better living for the family. She is an conscientious woman who is determined to achieve her set objectives.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer,  wheat and maize seeds

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 27 year old young woman, married and has one child. The family is residing in the province of Isabela. It's been Marivics's dream to own a motorcycle for subsistence, which was brought into reality through hard work and determination. Her husband is the one who drives their motorcycle,  sending passengers to designated areas safely. It allows them to earn PHP 4,000 a month, considering other sources of irregular income, too.

A loan of PHP 5,000 will absolutely help Marivic to repair her motorcycle. The availability of these funds is a channel to facilitate operations immediately. With this loan, Marivic is expecting to pursue her job with a motor vehicle in good running condition to provide satisfactory service to customers. She hopes to sustain the daily needs and improve further service capacity.

loans.use: to buy spare parts of her motorcycle business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is a 57-year-old married man with 1 child. He lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. Jaime is a food vendor. He makes ice cream to sell to his community. He also sells tempura and juice. He requested this loan to buy a small stove, tempura and ingredients for ice cream and juice. Jaime hopes for his business to improve.

loans.use: to buy a small stove, tempura and ingredients for ice cream and juice

loans.name: Evgeniya's Group

texts.en:
Evgeniya, 24, is the treasurer of this group. She lives with her parents and all the family members are engaged in farming.  At the same time Evgeniya earns additional money by reselling “Faberlic” cosmetics.  Every year the family cultivates potatoes and then sells them during the winter season, when the prices are high. She applies for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase more potatoes to resell in winter. Some part of the loan she will use to purchase coal for heating during the winter season. In the future Evgeniya wishes to open a grocery store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and coal

loans.name: Mirzosharif

texts.ru: Мирзошариф проживает в районе Яван. Ему 59 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Один из его сыновей находится на заработках заграницей. Сам Мирзошариф предоставляет услугу, занимается развозкой на своем грузовом автомобиле. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже семь лет. Кредит берет для ремонта грузового автомобиля.
texts.en: Mirzosharif lives in the Yavan district.  He is 59 years old, married and has seven children.  One of his sons is working abroad.  Mirzosharif provides a service; he is involved in transportation, using his truck.  He has been in this business for seven years.  Mirzosharif is requesting this loan to make repairs to his truck.

loans.use: to make repairs to his truck

loans.name: Ruhusa

texts.en:
Ruhusa is a 34 year old married man who sells used clothes at the New Market in Malindi. He has been in this business for the past thirteen years and he earns a monthly income of about KES.12,000 with which he uses to look after his family. 

Ruhusa has been loaned Kshs.40,000 by KADET LTD  and this serves as his third loan cycle from the company.  The client intends to use the loan to purchase additional stock of used clothes for sale. 

He will use the anticipated profit to provide basic needs for his family.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita  is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Rosita  has a shop that sells firewood & also bananas. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy  stocks of firewood for resale.
Rosita  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosita  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of firewood for resale

loans.name: Jinny Mae

texts.en: Jinny Mae is a 20-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 2, and 3 months. Jinny Mae's husband owns a vulcanizing shop and car wash. Jinny helps in managing their business. She also runs a small sari-sari store business. She sells items like sugar, vinegar, shampoo and other various products. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods. She hopes for her store to grow bigger. She also hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 36-year-old married woman with 4 children. Her children are aged between 8 and 15 years old.

Jocelyn is in the business of raising hogs. She has a small backyard piggery, which she hopes to expand in the future. She plans to use her loan to buy piglets, feed and vitamins. Jocelyn hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single mother with one child still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She has operated a beauty salon for the past year; her potential customers are her neighbors. In addition she also operates a cloth-selling business which contributes to her income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Demand is higher the end of the month than during the rest of the month. She dreams of opening a big beauty salon to accommodate more customers. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer services.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for the beauty salon business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Evolution Plus Group

texts.en:
Lyly, on the right, is the chairwoman of the community bank named “Evolution Plus” which consists of 24 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Lyly operates a general store in the western area of Kinshasa. She has been in business since 2001. She makes about $15 profit each day. She plans to use the next loan to diversify her business by buying fifty packages of hair tufts to resell at profit in order to increase her income. She dreams someday to open a food store in her environment. Lyly is 42 years old, married and the mother of three children aged between 7 and 11. All of them attend school. Lyly likes selling because it gives her the opportunity to make contact with many different people, and once they become permanent clients she is able to offer them quality products at a better price.

loans.use: to diversify her business by buying 50 packages of hair tufts to resell at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aimira's Group

texts.en:
Aimira is the treasurer of this group. She is 36 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she brings up a daughter and a son, both children study at school. Ten years ago the family started to breed cattle and now Aimira sells dairy products to make money for livelihood. She applies for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase one more cow for breeding. In the future Aimira dreams to purchase a car.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Narannyam

texts.en: Narannyam is 27 years old and a television broadcaster. He is unmarried and lives with his mom and brothers in the ger district of traditional Mongolian nomadic tents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a very hard-working man who want be busy all the weekdays. He has a plan to start a grocery store business near his home selling basic food commodities needed by the households around his store. This month he will start to build his store and needs money to buy the building materials necessary. He took a loan from other bank which he repaid successfully on time.

loans.use: To buy building materials necessary to build his grocery store.

loans.name: Ok Mufakose Group A

texts.en: Raphel is 45 years old and lives in Mufakose, Harare. He is married and his wife also sells vegetables. They have two children one of whom goes to school with the other child due to start soon. They also care for three additional dependants. Raphel buys and sells vegetables and has no other source of income. His main challenge is obtaining capital for his business. He will spend the money he borrows on buying more produce to sell. The additional income will help him in the upkeep of his family. In the next five years, Raphael plans to own a vegetable shop.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Solaika

texts.en:
Solaika is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Solaika runs a shop that sells home products like flash lights, batteries and hair accessories. She's been in business for 3 years. 

She requests a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional home products and accessories.

Solaika has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, She hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of products like home products  & accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new chain and gasoline for his transportation business

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en:
Zoljargal is 22-year-old and lives with her family in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Since February 2011, she has run a grocery store near her home.  Before that she operated a clothes shop called “Baby Shop” in another district. 

Zoljargal is an accountant and does all the accounting for her store by herself.  She hired a part-time salesperson to work in her store. 

Zoljargal wants a loan to purchase coal to heat her store and to supply food products, from local food vendors, to sell.  

She thinks she will expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase the coal to heat her store and food products to sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 61-year-old married man from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. 

He is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for quite a while now.   Joel works hard to support his family. 

He requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.  Joel hopes to continue earning a living from his farm so he can continue to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Rey has a shop that buys and sells bananas and fire wood.  He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fire wood for sell.  Rey is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fire wood for sell.

loans.name: United We Stand Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 23 years old.  She is married and her husband is a driver.  They have one, small child and live in Norton, about 40 kilometers from Harare.

Rosemary makes and sells school uniforms and ladies wear.  Her main issues are the rising costs of supplies and the need to replace her sewing machines. 

She does not need to rely upon her husband to put food on the table.

She will use the loan to buy cloth for school uniforms ahead of the new school term.  One day, Rosemary hopes to have a uniform factory that will supply many shops in the country

loans.use: to buy material for making school uniforms.

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en:
Davaajav, 47 is a freight transportation driver and he has been doing this job for 3 years. 

He lives with his wife and 3 sons in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Davaajav's wife makes traditional Mongolian garb.  They both are hard workers who try to improve their life day by day. 

They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  But it is a little bit cold and uncomfortable for such as big family.

Davaajav had planned to start a house building project before this winter.  But due to a lack of money to purchase building materials, he is requesting a loan.  He plans to install a smokeless-heating system in his dream house.  He says it is more beneficial for the environment.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to build his dream house.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is aged 56 and married with six children with only the last two still schooling. He lives with his family in Kitale, Western Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming. His farm currently produces milk and eggs for the local market.

Philip has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to  buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the cow will provide milk both for family consumption and commercial purposes. He says he will use the income to improve his family living standard as well as venture into the motorcycle business.

Philip laments animal feed shortages which limit dairy output significantly. He is keen on repaying the loan to acquire more amounts.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 40-year-old married woman with 6 children. The oldest is 22 years old. 

Leonila and her husband are farmers and till land in Trinidad, Bohol.  Rice is the main crop that they grow and sell.  She does her best to provide for their needs and to send her children to school.  She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. 

Leonila hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: C5660 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Leonille is 34 years old and is widow with two children between the ages of 4 and 18 years old.  She owns a business selling clothes.

Leonille is the leader of this group, called "Tuzamurane."   She has been in business for about two years and works from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm every day.  (She is the first person on the right side of the photo.)

Leonille and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company to increase their stock of clothes.  They plan to reinvest their profits in their businesses and save for their family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 52 years old and married. She has an 18-year-old child. 

Rebecca's husband works as a farmer and driver.  She helps her husband till their land in Trinidad, Bohol.  They also hire farmers to help plant rice sedlings on their land. 

Rebecca requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and to pay for labor.  She hopes that their farm will grow bigger.  Another one of Rebecca's goals is for her child to finish college and to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Monalisa buys and peddles clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON.

Monalisa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Monalisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more Masaai blankets and beads for making jewelry, earrings and necklaces for sale

loans.name: Reginalda

texts.en:
38-year-old Reginalda earns a living through farming. She tills land in Trinidad, Bohol with her husband. They primarily grow rice crops to sell.

Reginalda has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. Reginalda hopes for this loan to help them achieve an abundant harvest.

Reginalda has six children between the ages of 7 and 18. She hopes to have a stable income that will help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Vinani

texts.en:
Vinani is a married woman with three children. Two of her children attend school and one is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She has a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past three years. Her potential clients are the neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of the loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Boboaziz

texts.ru: Бобоазиз житель района А. Джоми. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Двое его сыновей находятся в России на заработках. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Бобоазиз уже 28 лет как занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа телят и коровы.
texts.en: Boboaziz lives in the A. Jomi district.  He is 55 years old, married and has four children.  Two of his sons are working in Russia.  His wife is a homemaker.  Boboaziz has been involved in breeding cattle for 28 years.  He breeds livestock for future sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves and a cow.

loans.use: to purchase calves and a cow

loans.name: Ife Lodou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE LODOU est formé de trois personnes qui mènent des activités complémentaires. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marie est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à Alain, un conducteur. Le couple a trois enfants. Des trois enfants, deux sont scolarisés. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants, et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Marie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Marie mène comme activité depuis cinq ans environs, la vente de bijoux et de vêtements par le système de distribution. Marie s'approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Marie n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigence. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Marie et les autres membres du groupe IFE LODOU sollicitent ensemble un second crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: IFE LODOU group consists of three people who run complementary activities. The representative of this group, Marie, is the one with the raised hand in the picture. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé to improve the level of their activity. Marie is 29 years old and is married to Alain, a driver. The couple has three children, two of which are attending school. Marie lives with her husband and their children and together with her husband she takes care of family expenses. Marie does not have a school education. To deal with her different responsabilities, including the business that she has been running for five years, the sale of jewelry and clothing by distribution system. Marie purchases her supplies in Benin and Togo. The customer demand is growing and given her limited resources, Marie can no longer respond to it. For this reason Marie and the other members of the IFE LODOU group are requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and clothing

loans.name: Aitbu

texts.en:
Aitbu is a resident of Gulcho, a nice village in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  She is 26 and together with her husband she runs a food stall. Aitbu is bringing up a son and two daughters; the son is at school and the daughters are preschool age (under seven).  

The family opened the food stall three years ago with an initial investment of 7000 soms. The monthly profit from this business is about 15,000 soms.  With the profits earned, Aitbu purchased a cow for breeding. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase onions and flour.  Some part of the loan she will use to purchase a carpet for their home. In the future Aitbu wishes to build a new house and provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase onions, flour and a carpet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Elsa has a retail shop that sells used clothing or "ukay-ukay". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of used clothing.

Elsa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing or "ukay-ukay".

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Kadiatu.  She is divorced, and has two children aged 19 and 22 years. She has three additional dependents, who live with her because they were not going to school in the village where they lived and since Kadiatu is living in the city and her children are now grown up, she decided to help the children of her relatives by bringing them to the city for better education .  

In 2008, Kadiatu established her drinks (soft and hard) business. Kadiatu started because she needed a means of income to help her husband support their family. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  

 Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy extra stout - 5 packets @ Le100,000, bottle parrot drink - 10 crates @ Le50,000, savannah - 10 packets @ Le140,000, Carlsberg beer - 10 crates @ Le120,000, soft drink in cans - 5 crates @ Le70,000 and pure drinking water - 20 bundles @ Le2,500. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  

In the future, Kadiatu hopes to buy a piece of land, build her own house and open another shop. Kadiatu is hard working and dedicated.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy extra stout - 5 packets @ Le100,000, bottle parrot drink - 10 crates @ Le50,000, savannah - 10 packets @ Le140,000, Carlsberg beer - 10 crates @ Le120,000, soft drink in cans - 5 crates @ Le70,000 and pure drinking water - 20 bundles @ Le2,500.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 23 years old.

Rizalina makes bread for a living. She sells her products to store owners in her town. Rizalina is happy to share that she has regular customers now.

Rizalina has requested this loan to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for making bread. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Cristita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Cristita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Cristita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia  is a farmer in Nkubu, Western Kenya. She is a widow with three children aged 16, 11 and 6 and all schooling. She has been in mixed farming for the last 10 years and her produce of bananas and milk goes to the local market. She gets additional income from her employment as a caretaker.

Anastasia has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming. She says this will help her improve her income and the living standard of her children since the returns in poultry are faster. She says she will use part of the income to buy better breeds of cows for better returns.

 She laments poor markets for the produce but reiterates that Juhudi Kilimo loans have made a turn-around in many farmers' lives. She had previously acquired 30,000 KES and 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Nichalika

texts.en:
Nichalika is a widow with four school-going children. She has a house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees for her children and the electricity bill.

She has operated a fish selling business for the past ten years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of establishing another fish shop on the other side of Kwale town.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase another freezer and add more fish to her business inventory. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of different loan products.

loans.use: To purchase another freezer and add more fish to sell.

loans.name: Julietcar

texts.en:
Julietcar is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Julietcar has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Julietcar is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Julietcar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beans and condiments

loans.name: Laurence Rose

texts.en:
Laurence Rose is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Laurence Rose is buying and selling clothing & beauty products from AVON & NATASHA. She has had this business for two years.She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON.

Laurence Rose  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Laurence Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Lea has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lea is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ri

texts.en: Ri sells cake, eggs, shampoo, soap, etc. She is 29 years old with two children. Her youngest son is still in school. She started her grocery store five years ago. She also raises pigs on the side. This is her first loan with VisionFund. With this loan, she hopes to increase her daily income from the grocery store, to raise more pigs, and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to increase her grocery stock.

loans.name: Maria Rodessa

texts.en:
Maria Rodessa is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Maria Rodessa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Maria Rodessa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maria Rodessa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Chreb is 47 years old and widowed with three children. Her children did not attend school. She has been raising pigs for several years. She also makes rice wine as additional income for the family. 

Chreb has been with VisionFund since 2010. She requested a loan from VisionFund to buy piglets and pig feed to increase her family's income. She already had pigs in her backyard and she has raised them well and now they are healthy and fat. She hopes to do the same with her new piglets.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Seur

texts.en: Seur is 52 years old with five children. Her youngest son works in Thailand. She has been with VisionFund since 2010 and her family has been farming on the rice field for many generations. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field and spice plantation. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and also earn more income from her plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Ma. Teresa has a retail shop that sells used clothing or "ukay-ukay". She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of used clothing.

Ma. Teresa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ma. Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing or "ukay-ukay".

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various products for resale (soap, women's cosmetics, toothpaste, pens, notepads, etc.)

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор проживает в районе А. Джоми. Она замужем. Ей 27 лет. Она не имеет высшего образования. Более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Gulbahor lives in the A. Jomi district.  She is 27 years old and married.  She does not have a higher education.  Gulbahor has been involved in animal husbandry for over seven years.  She primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of cattle.

loans.use: to buy several heads of cattle

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Louise, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Louise est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Jean. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Louise et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants, et contribuent ensemble aux diverses charges du ménage. Louise n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Louise prépare de la nourriture (riz et du haricot) qu'elle vend dans une école du Sud du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Louise vend des produits divers à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Louise s’approvisionne dans un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Louise désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Louise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Mahugnon group is comprised of three people who all live together in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Louise, is the woman with her hand raised in the photo. This is the fourth time this group has sought financial support from Alidé with the intention of expanding their business.

Louise is 46 years old and is married to a mechanic by the name of Jean. The couple has five children, all of them under their care and in school. Louise and her husband live together with their children, and both contribute to the various household expenses. Louise did not attend school. Louise prepares food (rice and beans) that she sells in a school in the south of Benin. In addition to this business, she also sells various goods from her home, which allows her to keep up with the needs of her family and to provide for them with little trouble.

Louise purchases her supplies in one of the markets of Benin. With the intention of better meeting customer demand, Louise wants to increase her stock. In order to do so, she is seeking a fourth loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Mahugnon group.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and beans, and various goods.

loans.name: Reggie

texts.en:
Reggie is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Reggie has a shop that sells assorted fruit like mangoes & bananas. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fruits to sell.

Reggie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Reggie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy lots of shoes for resale

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en: Sadek is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. He has owned a car repair shop in his town since 2008 and has seven years of experience working in the field; he began to learn this occupation when he was very young. And today, with his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l he will be able to purchase a scanner machine and new mechanic's tools. In the future, he is planning to enlarge his store and start a car spare parts sales business.

loans.use: to purchase a scanner and new mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 55-year-old Lebanese widowed woman living with her only child and three siblings. She has been working as a cook since 2010. Her job is to prepare and cook food in her home then sell it to customers. Today, she is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new oven. She needs to increase her productivity before the winter season as her business sales increase during that period.  In the future, she would like to rent out a small space to sell her merchandise. For the time being, she will continue to sell goods from her home.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and six siblings. He has five years of experience working as a construction laborer. He works on a freelance basis, sticking with multiple individual jobs. With his business income, this young man is able to help his father with the household expenses. Today, he is asking to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase construction materials. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening his own office and working closely with construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Midonougbo Group

texts.fr: MIDONOUGBO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même localité au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer leur activité. La représentante du groupe, Célestine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un mécanographe du nom de Grégoire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Célestine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Célestine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Célestine vend des produits cosmétiques, des chaussures et des trousseaux de façon secondaire. Célestine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Célestine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Célestine sollicite un crédit avec les membres du groupe MIDONOUGBO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Midonougbo is a group of three people who live near one another in Benin. This is the first time this group is seeking a loan from Alidé in order to strengthen their business.

The group's representative, Célestine (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 45 years old and is married to an equipment operator by the name of Grégoire. The couple has four children, all of them under their care and in school. Célestine and her husband live together with their children. Célestine did not attend school.

Célestine has been selling cosmetic products, as well as secondhand shoes and clothing for nearly ten years. She is passionate about her business, which allows her to meet the needs of her family and her children. Célestine purchases her supplies in Benin. In her desire to satisfy her clients, Célestine is seeking a loan with the members of the Midonougbo group. This loan will allow them to better respond to customer demand and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic proucts.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children. He is an experienced construction worker specialized in floor covering and cleaning. He has been involved in this occupation for the past 13 years. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of the household expenses (health, education and many other expenses). 

With his requested loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase a new flooring machine. He notes that this machine will remarkably smooth the progress of his work. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase a new flooring machine.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. This young man started his business in 2009 working as a private teacher receiving students at his house. He is especially talented at giving biology-chemistry lessons. His business is very important because with its income, he is able to help his parents pay for his university education fees.  

As is common in the young Lebanese generation, he has a job and is pursuing his education at the same time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his courses at the university. His only purpose is to pursue his education until graduating without facing financial issues.

loans.use: to pay for his courses at the university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her purchases of flowers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pesticides, pay labor, and buy other farm inputs.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has six years of experience working as a home electrician. He works upon request from clients. He assists his father who works as a plumber to satisfy the family needs. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase electrical tools and supplies. He feels positive about his business prospects and looks forward to working on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: to purchase electrical tools and supplies

loans.name: Efelegbe Group

texts.fr: EFELEGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Débola (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Raphaël. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Débola et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Débola n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a dix ans environs que Débola fait le commerce de produits divers à son domicile. Débola s’approvisionne au Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Débola sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EFELEGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à rehausser le stock de leurs produits.
texts.en: Efelegbe is a group of three people who live in the same district in Benin. The representative of the group, Débola (who has her hand raised in the photo), is 43 years old and married to a driver called Raphaël. The couple has six children, all at school and in their care. Débola and her husband live with their children. Débola did not attend school and has been selling a variety of products from her home for around ten years. She gets her supplies in Benin. This activity allows her to provide for her own needs and those of her children. With a view to satisfying customer demand, Débola is requesting a first loan from Alidé together with the other members of the Efelegbe group. This loan will allow them to boost their stock of goods.

loans.use: to purchase various products

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a businessman who sells clothes to earn a living.  With income from his business, he is able to provide for his wife and two children.  He has been running his business for eleven years and he has employed one person.  He has managed to grow the business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.

Robert hopes to open other outlets of his business within five years.  He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 33 years old. She is a single mother, blessed with two children aged 9 and 14. She has been operating a child-care business for the past five years earning a monthly income of KES 17,000, which she uses to support her children's basic needs.


She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET staff member. Purity will use the loan to buy chairs and tables for her child-care business to increase her business income. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to open a private primary school which will help her support her family.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables for her child-care business

loans.name: Tolibchon

texts.ru: Толибчон женат и ответственный отец 4 детей. Он занимается купля продажей промышленными товарами. Он умный и целеустремленный человек. Более 4 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и у него очень богатый опыт по данному бизнесу. Толибчон в основном продает ковровые изделия. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США. Он заранее благодарить  всех кредиторов за их поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Tolibchon is a married and responsible father of four children.  He is involved in buying and selling industrial products.  He is a smart and goal-oriented person.  He has been involved in this business for over four years and has a very rich experience in this business.  Tolibchon primarily sells rugs.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 to achieve this goal.  He thanks all creditors in advance for their support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. He has owned a shoe shop since 2009. He also sells women bags. Mohamad is considered a new business owner but due to his high competency at work, he was able to noticeably develop his business and even hire a full-time employee working as a salesman. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional merchandise for his business. The winter season is about to begin and he needs to get the new winter shoes and bags collection to satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for his business

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and only sibling. He has owned a barber shop since 2009. He is well-known in the whole region and has a good reputation.  Like the majority of Lebanese guys, he helps his family with his business income. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new shaving tools. In the future, he is planning to buy a laser machine and start providing his customers with these services in order to satisfy them.

loans.use: to purchase new shaving tools

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 61 years old, married, and has three children.  He sells gas cylinders so as to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years.  His wife assists him in the business.  He has grown the business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  He also sells firewood to supplement his income.

Francis hopes to expand his business in the future for more income generation.  He needs 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy gas cylinders for cooking.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders for cooking.

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru: Расул ответственный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и у них трое детей. Он хочет содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и всегда старается зарабатывать много денег. С этим путем он начал заниматься откармливанием скота. Он имеет хорошую условию для своих скот. Расул успешно продолжает данный бизнес уже более 10 лет и за эти многие годы он научил все слабые стороны бизнеса. Расул хотел бы получит займ в размере 9300 Сомони для покупки овца с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Rasul is a responsible and goal-oriented person.  He is married and has three children.  He wants to provide a good quality of life for his family and always tries to earn more money.  He started this path by getting involved in fattening up livestock.  Rasul has good conditions for his livestock.  He has been successfully running this business for over 10 years and learned all of the business weaknesses during these years.  Rasul wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 9300 Somoni for the purchase of sheep in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy ten heads of sheep

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 36-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a car wash in his village since 2006. In addition, he works as a mechanic specialized in changing cars' oil. He works hard and helps his father, who works as a farmer, with the household expenses. Today, he is applying for a loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his work by purchasing additional car oil. He hopes that the loan will help him increase his business productivity and therefore his income.

loans.use: to improve his work by purchasing additional car oils

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 35 years old, married to Joseph. Together they are blessed with four children. She is a greengrocer (a retail trader in fruit and vegetables) in the Tala market selling things like cabbages, onions, carrots and tomatoes. She has been in the business for the past three years. She earns a monthly income of KES.5,000.


This is her first loan in KADET LTD. She plans to buy more stock of assorted vegetables for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children and provide for the basic needs of her family. 

Her dream is to purchase a plot for the family and establish her business there. She is very hardworking

loans.use: To buy cabbage, onions, carrots, and tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 26 years old and married.  She operates a pharmacy so as to earn a living.  She has been in the business for one year and has employed two people.  Previously, she was employed as a laboratory technician.  She has grown her business after getting knowledge of business management skills through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.

Peninah hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She has requested  30,000 Kenya shillings to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy green maize, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 43 years old. She is married to Daudi and they are blessed with three children who are school-going.

Rebecca owns a bakery in the Kitengela market, where she supplies cakes to shops, schools and supermarkets. She has been doing this business for the last year and gets an income of 8,450 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Rebecca was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD., with which she plans to buy flour, baking powder, sugar and a motorbike for distribution. She will use the extra profit to open a branch in Mlolongo.

Rebecca hopes to establish a big baking factory in which to bake and supply cakes and breads. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for distribution.

loans.name: Henrik

texts.en:
Henrik is 44 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Sevan area with his wife and a son. Henrik’s son attends a village school; his wife is jobless and she helps Henrik in his occupation. 

Since 1996, Henrik has been breeding cows and calves on his farm. Henrik and his wife work very hard and thus provide their family with fresh and natural produce. Henrik sells part of the derived milk and meat to procurement agencies and to butchers. 

Henrik is sure that cattle head growth will lead to his farm developing and his family’s income increasing. Therefore, he needs 800,000 Armenian drams to buy some calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy some calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 44 years old. She is an enterprising business lady. She is married to Isaac, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged 14 and 10 years respectively.  

She has been in a green grocer business for the past 10 years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family. Virginia is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

Virginia will use the loan to buy vegetables, potatoes and fruits for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy farming and open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, potatoes and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Fortunetus

texts.en:
Fortunetus is 52 years old, married and has five children.  He does carpentry so as to earn a living for his family.  He has been in the business for twelve years and has employed two people.  He also runs a grocery shop so as to supplement his income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business hence his living standard.

Fortunetus hopes to become financially stable within five years.  He has requested 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy timber for making furniture.

loans.use: To buy timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Washington

texts.en: Washington is 35 years old and lives in Logan Town. He is single and has two children, ages  4 and 14; both of them are currently in school. He has been operating a provision shop for the past two years. Now he has more customers, so he wants to expand his business, but he has a small amount of capital that he operates his business with. He's requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, soap, tissue, batteries and toothpaste for his business. He plans to build a house for his children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, soap, tissue, batteries and toothpaste for his business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Antonia es soltera, tiene 28 años de edad, reside con sus padres en la ciudad de Curuguaty.
Antonia es propietaria de un copetín-comedor. Ella abrió dicho negocio con el fruto de sus esfuerzos, comenzó con un pequeño local, ahora día a día está creciendo, y desea poder haciéndolo.
Gracias a este negocio ella puede generar los ingresos con los cuales puede ayudar a su familia y paliar los gastos que diariamente aparece en la casa. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir agrandando su local y de esa forma atraer a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y otros con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Antonia is single, 28 years old, and lives with her parents in the city of Curuguaty. Antonia is the proprietress of a snack-bar / diner. She opened the business through her own hard work, starting with a small location. Now it is growing it day by day and she would like to keep it growing.

Thanks to her business, she is able to generate income to help her family and ease the burden of daily expenses around the house. One of her dreams is to be able to keep expanding the premises, and thus attract more customers. She is seeking the loan to buy food, drinks, dairy products and other things with which to stock her business and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy food, drinks, dairy products and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuff and a TV set for his hotel.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a widowed woman with no children. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for herself and electricity.

She has operated a business selling sundry products for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are her neighboring residents. She faces a major challenge of low stock turnover. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase more sundry products for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loans.

loans.use: To purchase more sundry products for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widowed woman with one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are house rent and food for her family.

She has operated a business selling clothes for the past five years. Her potential clients are the neighboring community. She faces a major challenge of transportation costs from the neighboring country. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase clothes for her new male line. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loans.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for her new male line.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to his business inventory.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Шарифа жительница города Вахдат. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Шарифа имеет среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей более 16 лет. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает ткани и детскую одежду. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара. То есть для покупки осенней детской одежды и новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Sharifa lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 49 years old, married and has five children.  Sharifa has a secondary education.  She has been involved in sales for over 16 years.  She has a retail outlet, where she sells fabrics and children's clothing.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise, i.e. fall children's clothing and new types of fabrics.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one sack of "bissaps" (dried hibiscus flowers used to flavor drinks), one sack of "teedo" (monkey bread) and 50 kg of sugar.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a divorced woman with one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees for her child. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past seven years; her potential clients are local retailers. She faces the major challenge of government policies on fish sales. She dreams of establishing another fish shop in town. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase a freezer and fish for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer and fish for her business.

loans.name: Umoja Kibabi Group

texts.fr:
La cliente Baseme, leader du groupe d’affaire «Umoja Kibabi », est  jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 37  ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants tous étudient convenablement.  Son mari est chômeur (sans emploi). En dehors de ses enfants légitimes, elle héberge également  4 autres enfants de sa famille élargie (cousin, neuve, voisin du village). Elle est vendeuse des  boissons (bière Primus, Mutzing et Fanta, etc.). Elle expose ses produits devant des boutiques des amis et connaissances (sur la voie publique, rond point Signers) pour la vente en gros et parfois à son domicile c’est la vente en détails. Elle a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son beau père sous forme d’assistance. Son capital initial était 20$ équivalent aux deux caisses de la bière Primus. Il y a 16 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  33 casiers de Fanta et Primus.
Elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client named Baseme, the leader of the business group called «Umoja Kibabi », is a young entrepreneur of 37, married and the mother of five children, who are all studying appropriately. Her husband is jobless. Besides her legitimate children, she also shelters four other children from her extended family (a cousin, a nephew, neighbors from the village). 

She sells drinks: Primus beer, Mutzig beer, and Fanta (orange soda), etc. She displays her products in front of the shops of friends and acquaintances (on the roadside, at the Signers traffic circle) to be sold wholesale and sometimes, out of her home, retail. She began her little business with her own money, received from her father-in-law as a form of assistance. Her initial working capital amounted to $20, or the price of two cases of Primus beer. She has been in this business for 16 years. This new loan will allow her to buy 33 cases of Fanta and Primus. 

She hopes to see her children grow up comfortably and to expand her business. This client thanks Hekima for its efforts on behalf of poor women who are excluded from conventional banking services.

loans.use: to buy 33 cases of Fanta and Primus (beer).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you Aminata, a small-scale entrepreneur from Matotoka, a village in northern Sierra Leone. A native of Matotoka village, near Magburaka, Aminata is 36 years old. She is married with three children – one in primary school, one in secondary school and the other is not of school-going age. 

Aminata sells provisions – sugar, milk, butter, mayonnaise, etc. and rice.  She has been a businesswoman for over five years now. She has requested this loan in order to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, butter, mayonnaise, etc. and rice in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 49 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Ruth who is also a farmer. They are blessed with three children aged 10, nine and eight years respectively. He has been a farmer for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family members.


He is applying for his sixth loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Isaac will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy a dairy cow. His hopes and dreams are to export farm produce which will increase his income and help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Aissata

texts.fr: Commerçante, elle habite dans une ville du Sénégal et s'active dans la vente de chaussures local qui sont fabriquées par des artisans. Cette commerçante fait dans la vente des chaussures depuis 2003 ou elle a commancé avec un petit montant. Avec ce prêt, elle veut relancer son activité qu'elle avait arrété a cause de son accouchement. Elle veut acheter de nouveaux marchandises pour augmenter son stock de marchandises qui avait diminuer suite a l'arret de ses activités. Ce prêt lui permettra de se relancer de nouveau et de reprendre son activité ou elle avait du profit.
texts.en: A retailer, this lady lives in a town in Sénégal and sells shoes made by local artisans. She has been selling shoes since 2003 and she began with a small sum as working capital. With this loan, she wants to get her business up and running again, as she was obliged to stop it when she gave birth. She wants to buy new merchandise to add to her stock which had diminished during the period where she had to stop working. This loan will allow her to take her profitable business back up where she left off.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hard-working business woman aged 39. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last 13 years, she has been managing a salon to earn a living. She has grown her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  

In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a hair blow dryer and hair braids.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and hair braids.

loans.name: Mauna

texts.en:
Mauna is a married woman with five school-going children. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three years; in addition, her husband contributes towards the family expenses. Her potential clients are local area residents. Her major challenge is the cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it enables small-scale entrepreneurs to expand their business through loan lending.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking business woman aged 50. She is married and blessed with five children. For the last five years, she has been rearing pigs to make a living. She also practices dairy farming.  Previously, she was doing tailoring.

 In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to construct a pigpen and buy more pigs.

loans.use: To construct a pig shed and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a determined businesswoman aged 33.  She is married and blessed with three children.  She has been rearing pigs to support her family. 
Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business hence improving her living standards.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a married woman with five school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six months, Patience has been operating a charcoal selling business. She sells at the market to market dwellers and retailers. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation from the rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a vast market share in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mumini

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Mumini, a small-scale entrepreneur from Matotoka, a village in northern Sierra Leone. A native of Matotoka, the 61-year-old is married to a trader and the couple has five children – one in primary school, two in secondary school, one in college and one adult.

 Mumini sells drinks and provisions. He has been a businessman for over 10 years now. Mumini has requested this loan in order to expand his business. He will use it to buy 25 crates of soft drinks, beer and stout.

loans.use: to buy 25 crates of soft drinks, beer and stout.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a hardworking businesswoman aged 27 and she is married. For the last two years, she has been managing a pharmacy to make a living. She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy medicines.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a hardworking businessman aged 26. He is married and blessed with two children who are in school. He does electronic repairs so as to earn a living. He hopes to open other outlets of his business for more income generation.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy spare parts for televisions and radios.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for television and radios.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Bineta  habite Sénégal. Elle est mariée et âgée  de 26 ans. Elle évolue depuis 2 ans dans le domaine du commerce. Elle s’adonne a la vente de déjeuner, de jus locaux et de glace. Elle a choisi son activité dans let le souci  de s’activer et de lutter contre la dépendance. Elle est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 prévus pour l’achat d’un réfrigérateur qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de son commerce. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de mieux développer son activité.
texts.en:
Bineta lives in Senegal. She is married and is 26 years old. For two years, she has been developing a business. Her business is devoted to selling lunch, local juices and ice cream. Bineta chose her business in hopes of enabling herself and fighting dependence. She has been a member of one of the offices of UIMCEC since March 2011.

Bineta is seeking a loan of 150,000 CFA francs in order to purchase a refrigerator, which will be used to meet the needs of her business. This funding will allow her to increase her profits and better build her business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks and clothes for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo D. unos grupos D. señoras que se agruparon y decidieron formar el comité dentro del barrio. Este comité es D. la Ciudad D. San Lorenzo. El objetivo principal D. ellas es el crecimiento D. cada una D. ellas, desean poder sobresalir no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
La Señora Nélida, presidenta del grupo tiene 32 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy optimista. Ella se dedica a la venta D. artículos varios. Comenta que gracias a esto ella ha podido brindarle a su familia los medios necesarios para brindarles una vida digna y decorosa. Además D. eso cuenta que tiene muchas ventas y pedidos D. sus clientes con lo cual le gustaría poder cumplir.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, harina y bebidas para poder cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
The United Women Communal Bank, or Mujeres Unidas Comité, was formed through the management and support of a few groups of women that got together and decided to form the committee within their neighborhood. This committee is of the City of San Lorenzo. The women’s principal objective is the growth of each member; they want to succeed not only economically, but also personally.

Ms. Nélida is the president of the group. She is 32 and is very enterprising, hardworking, and optimistic. She sells various articles. She says that thanks to that, she has been able to offer her family the means necessary to proviD. a dignified, respectable life. In addition, she says that she makes a lot of sales and has a lot of orders from her clients that she would like to fulfill.
