She is requesting the loan to purchase sugar, beans, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, drinks, oil, and flour to be able to fulfill the requests of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, beans, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, drinks, oil, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.en:
Filbert, who is in his late 20s, is married with two children, and one of them goes to school. He has had a fruit and vegetables business since 2005. He works from 6 a.m. to 8.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to build his small house, bought a TV, a fridge and paid household expenses. He also increased his fruit and vegetables stock. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables. His dream is to one day be able to build more rooms.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Faraja" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock and sell.

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es: Carla Vanessa tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella es una persona muy dedicada pues siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le están solicitando. Inicio con el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus hijos que esta menores de edad, ella quiere brindarles todo lo necesario para que tengan un buen futuro. Carla se prepara todos los días para ofrecer bolsos, camisas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, perfumes, cremas, tratamientos prendas, entre otros productos así sus clientes saben que ella siempre les ofrece variedad. Es por eso que desea este crédito para la compra de materia prima que será invertida en su negocio.
texts.en:
Carla Vanessa has a business selling general merchandise.  She is a very dedicated person because she is always aware of what her customers are asking her for.  She began with the goal of getting her children ahead.  Her children are minors, so she wants to give them everything that is necessary for them to have a good future.

Carla is prepared every day to offer purses, shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, underwear, perfume, lotions, treatments, and household articles, among other products.  So her customers know that she always offers them variety.  This is why she wants this loan, to buy the raw materials that she will invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy purses, shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, underwear, perfume, lotions, treatments, and household articles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her journey to Mecca.

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela, D. cuarenta y un años D. edad, casada, vive en casa propia en zona semiurbana al oriente del país junto a sus dos hijos uno D. 18 y otro D. 14 años D. edad, Karla y Alexis quienes actualmente sólo estudian, son su inspiración para día a día luchar por vivir mejor. Ángela hace cinco años después D. quedar sola porque su esposo se marchó al extranjero en búsqueda D. mejores oportunidades instaló una tienda en su misma casa D. residencia en donD. provee a sus vecinos y gente que pasa productos D. primera necesidad, con esta actividad logra el sostenimiento económico para su familia, Gracias a Dios a ellos no les ha hecho falta el pan diario. Pese a que su esposo envía remesa ésta no compensa las necesidades que cada año incrementan dado que ella desea darles estudios universitarios a sus hijos y que se conviertan en profesionales y resuelvan D. mejor forma sus vidas.  María Ángela a sabiendas que cuenta con excelentes referencias manejando prestamos, posee varios años manejando el negocio y la necesidad D. hacerlo crecer para mejorar las calidad D. vida D. su familia,  son todas estas juntas las razones por las que decidió solicitar a INTEGRAL crédito que permita comprar productos que demandan sus clientes y no ha podido hacerlo con recurso propio como son: Escobas, productos para el cuidado personal (desodorantes, gelatinas para el cabello, cremas para la piel, cosméticos), medicina, lácteos, carnes, embutidos, detergentes y además piensa comprar nueva vitrina para exhibir algunos D. éstos nuevos productos. Tiene la esperanza depositada en esta nueva inversión y espera que supliendo las necesidades D. sus clientes obtendrá mayores ventas y así ganancias.-
texts.en:
María Ángela, 41, is married and lives in her own home in a semi-urban area in the eastern part of the country along with her two children, 18 and 14.  Karla and Alexis, who currently only study, are her inspiration for struggling day by day to live better.

After her husband left her alone five years ago in search of better opportunities abroad, she installed a store in her house to proviD. her neighbors and passersby with basic household necessities.  With this activity she manages to support her family.  Thank God they have never lacked their daily bread.  Even though her husband sends remittances, they are not enough for the necessities that every year increase given that she wants her children to have a university education and become professionals and determine their lives in the best way.

María Ángela knowingly has excellent references managing loans.  She has managed her business for several years, and the need to make it grow to improve her family's quality of life.

All these together are the reasons she decided to request a loan from Integral, which will allow her to buy products that her customers ask for and that she has not been able to proviD. with her own resources: brooms, personal care products (deodorant, hair gel, skin cream, cosmetics), medicine, dairy products, meat, sausage, detergent, and a new display case to show some of these new products.

She has all her hope placed in this new investment and hopes that supplying the needs of her customers will obtain greater sales and so profits.

loans.use: to buy brooms, personal care products (deodorant, hair gel, skin cream, cosmetics), medicine, dairy products, meat, sausage, detergent, and a new display case to show some of these new products.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is a hardworking businesswoman aged 23. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last two years, she has been selling clothes to earn a living. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more business-oriented.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes and handbags.

loans.use: To buy clothes and handbags.

loans.name: Sumayah's Group

texts.en:
Sumayah's Group is comprised of five hard-working women. Sumayah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past 10 years, Sumayah has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which makes adjustments to clothes and also makes clothes from scratch. 

To help expand her business, Sumayah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine and more cloth, and will help Sumayah to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Sumayah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Sumayah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sumayah's future prospects by helping her to start her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and more cloth

loans.name: Syphrose

texts.en: Syphrose is a hardworking businesswoman aged 49. She is married and has six children. For the last eleven years, she has been selling curtains to make a living. She has improved the business because she has been trained in business management skills through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.  In the next 5 years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy more curtains.

loans.use: To buy curtains.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with one child who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a beauty salon business, operating in a shop whereby the local residents are her potential customers. She faces the major challenge of price fluctuation in the area. Her major challenge is to establish a bigger beauty salon business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase weave braids, chemicals and washing shampoo. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase weave braids, chemicals and washing shampoo.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina is a 34-year-old businesswoman and married mother of four children, all of whom attend school.  For the last three years, Edina has been running a tailoring business to earn a living. She also relies on her husband's support in the business.  In the next five years, Edina wants to expand her business and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Pedro Claver

texts.es:
Pedro es un luchador incansable que toda su vida ha enfrentado las dificultades con tenacidad, y ha procurado salir adelante frente a la adversidad, y como padre de 5 hijos siempre ha trabajado con esmero para brindarles un mejor futuro, sin embargo las posibilidades económicas son muy pocas, Pedro trabaja como asistente de construcción, lo que le dificulta tener un ingreso fijo.

A sus 46 años de edad, sueña con tener su propio negocio, motivo por el cual hoy solicita un crédito con el cual dar el primer paso, pues ya tiene contactos que le ayudarán a emprender este nuevo reto y con el préstamo comprará el primer surtido para su legumbrería que espera con el tiempo tenga un progreso económico, mejorando así su calidad de vida, y le brinde la oportunidad de que éste sea el legado que pueda dejarle a su familia
texts.en:
Peter is a tireless fighter, who has been persistent in the face of difficulties and made his way through adversity. He is a father of 5 children and has always worked diligently to provide a better future for his family, but there are very few economic opportunities. Peter works as a construction assistant, but this makes it difficult to have a fixed income.

At 46 years old, Peter dreams of owning his own business which is why he has applied for this loan, with which he will take the first step. He already has the contacts he needs help him undertake this new challenge, and with the loan he can buy the best produce for his vegetable stall. With time he hopes to progress financially and improve their quality of life, and this loan gives him the opportunity to build a legacy that he can leave to his family.

loans.use: to purchase produce to stock his vegetable stall

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en:
Eva's Group is comprised of three hard-working women. Eva is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past six years, Eva has been working hard to manage her small restaurant, which provides an outside catering service to local families and businesses. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy corn and food for resale, and will help Eva to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Eva hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Eva's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to buy corn and food for resale

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel, a 31-year-old businessman and married father of two children who are in school, has been managing a retail shop to earn a living for the last four years. He hopes to grow the business into a wholesale operation in the future, and is now requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar and rice for his store.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: C2389 Dukundumurimo Group

texts.en:
Edith is 42 years old and is a widow, the mother of three children aged between 15 and 29. Edith is the leader of the group called "Dukundumurimo". Her business is well-known. She sells bananas and has been in operation for two years, working from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She currently employs one person to help her. In the photo, Edith is the second person from the right.

Edith and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their banana businesses by purchasing more good bananas for sale. They will reinvest additional profits into their businesses and save money to pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossy's Group is comprised of two hard-working women. Prossy is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past year, Prossy has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells food and charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food and charcoal for resale, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Prossy's future prospects by helping her to work hard at building her business.

loans.use: to buy food and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to start a transportation business.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a firewood selling business which contributes as another source of income. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Pauline dreams of establishing a real estate agency in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and firewood for resale.

loans.name: San Ramón Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres muy trabajadoras, luchadoras y solidarias las unas con las otras se unieron para formar el comité llamado San Ramón, mediante el cual desean poder generar mayores ingresos para sus familias y de esa forma poder ser muy útiles y sacar a delante a todos los que dependen de ellas. Se definen como muy sacrificadas, pues la mayoría de ellas trabajan muy duro en actividades que requieren de mucha fuerza física.
Una de las miembros es la señora Clara, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Comenta que este es su medio de subsistencia, ya que gracias a esto es logra mantener su casa y a su familia. Dice que tiene muchos clientes y pedidos siempre, además de eso tiene una clientela bien formada pues hace un tiempo ya que se dedica a esto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo para la posterior venta, pues tiene muchos pedidos y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
Ten women who work hard, struggle and are supportive of one another got together to form the communal bank called San Ramón.  Through the bank they want to generate more income for their families and help those who are dependent on them to get ahead.  They consider themselves to be self-sacrificing since most of them work in activies requiring a lot of physical strength.

One of the members is Mrs. Clara who sells all kinds of clothing.  This is her only source of income and it has helped her maintain her household and family.  She claims to have many customers and orders, and her customer base is long standing because of the years she has been in business.

She is requesting a loan to buy all types of clothing to sell.  She has many orders and wants to fill them all.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Saum is a married woman with four school-going children; they live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost incurred during transportation of charcoal from rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is 35 years old and married to a trader. They have five children, all of whom are in the school. She has a business selling bread and ice cream in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Joice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread to sell. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighboring community members. She faces the major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. Kuvuna dreams of establishing more retail shops in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Pombe

texts.en:
Pombe is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman and he supports his family's basic needs. 

For the past 10 years, Pombe has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality especially during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to operate. Pombe dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase cereals and cooking fat oil for her food stall business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and cooking fat oil for her food stall business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 12 years, she has operated a poultry business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of theft because of lack of security in her area of operation. Alice dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture for his room.

loans.name: Ernestina Del Socorro

texts.es: Ernestina Del Socorro tiene 51 años, su actividad es una pulpería y venta de comida. Hace más de 34 años que tiene este negocio, inicio porque tenía que sacar adelante a sus hijos fue madre soltera y la necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos vestimenta, salud y educación. El motivo del crédito es para invertirlo en la compra gaseosas, granos básicos, detergentes, fósforos, cigarrillos y otros productos.
texts.en: 51-year-old Ernestina Del Socorro runs a small grocery store and sells food. She has had this business for more than 34 years, and started it because she was a single mother who had to bring up her children and provide clothing, healthcare and education for them. This loan will be used to invest in buying soft drinks, grains, detergents, matches, cigarettes and other products.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, grains, detergents, matches, cigarettes and other products for her store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry selling business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and restaurant operators. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and disease outbreaks in her place of operation. Janet dreams of expanding her poultry business in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado San Miguel está integrado por 11 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas D. esa ciudad. Ellas se organizaron con el propósito D. ayudar a sus familias y sus hijos, quieren que ellos tengan un mejor porvenir del que ellas tuvieron, desean darles una vida digna y decorosa.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Nélida, ella tiene una peluquería en la cual diariamente atienD. a muchas personas, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos. Comenta que este negocio es lo que la ayuda a generar los ingresos necesarios para poder mantener a su familia, como así también poder paliar los gastos D. la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. tintes, gel, sprays y otros insumos necesarios para la peluquería. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues D. obtener el crédito le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Miguel is comprised of 11 women who are friends and neighbors in the same city.  They got together to help their families and children since they want them to have a better future than they had, with a dignified, proper lifestyle.

One of the members is Mrs. Nélida who has a beauty salon where she works daily attending to many customers.  She has been able to generate a decent income through the business, which helps her maintain the family and cover household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy hair color, gel, sprays and other supplies for her beauty salon.  She is grateful to the Fundación for this opportunity since the loan will be very helpful.

loans.use: To buy hair color, gel, scissors and other beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Bihija

texts.en:
Bihija is a single woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and her children's school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, sugar and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Oscar Arnulfo

texts.es:
Don Oscar tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos.

Don oscar trabaja en la crianza de ganado y en la agricultura desde hace 10 años. Este trabajo lo aprendió de su papá, ya que por ser de escasos recursos económicos no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y ha dedicado al trabajo desde muy pequeño.

Para adquirir los insumos que él necesita, Don Oscar debe caminar durante 10 minutos a pie hasta el lugar donde espera una camioneta, y viaja en la palangana de la camioneta durante 45 minutos. Después toma un bus y viaja en el durante una hora. 

Don Oscar solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar una yunta de bueyes. El se ha dado cuenta que en las comunidades vecinas casi nadie tiene bueyes para realizar trabajos relacionados con la agricultura (como para arar la tierra para sembrar). De esta manera él ha visto una oportunidad de obtener buenos ingresos, ya que el cobrará por los trabajos que realice a personas de otras comunidades. 

Con el préstamo, Don Oscar podrá tener una fuente de ingresos que le permitirá enviar a sus 3 pequeños hijos a la escuela, ya que él no quiere que sus hijos tengan su mismo nivel de vida.

Don Oscar desea que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente. También quiere comprar un terreno para cultivar maíz  y fríjol. Con la venta de estos obtendria mayores ingresos, los cuales utilizaría para comprar más ganado, y tambien almacenaría parte del  maíz y fríjol para asegurar la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
32-year-old Oscar lives with his life partner and their three children. He has been working in agriculture and raising livestock for 10 years, and learned this trade from his father. As his family had limited financial resources, he did not have the opportunity to study and therefore started working at a very young age.  To acquire the supplies he needs for his work, Oscar has to walk 10 minutes to the place where he waits for a van to pick him up, travels in the van for 45 minutes and then travels one hour by bus.

Oscar has requested this loan from the foundation in order to purchase a team of oxen. He has realized that almost none of the neighboring communities have oxen to carry out agricultural work (such as plowing soil for planting). He has seen an opportunity to earn good income, as he will charge for the work undertaken for the people in the neighboring communities.

With this loan, Oscar could generate a revenue that will allow him to send their three small children to school, as he does not want his children to have the same standard of living. Oscar wants his children to be prepared professionally. He also wants to buy some land to grow corn and beans. Through the sale of his produce he would increase his income, which he would invest in buying more cattle, and would also store some of the corn and beans to ensure there is enough food for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a team of oxen

loans.name: Margarita Trinidad

texts.es: Margarita Trinidad tiene 25 años, hace más de 1 año que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora por lo que disfruta de realizar su negocio con el entusiasmo que lo realiza todos los días. Ella ofrece productos como lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios, polvos, cremas, tratamientos, ropa interior. Ella se levanta temprano desde las siete de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche que regresa a su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: Margarita Trinidad is 25 years old, and has been selling cosmetics for more than a year.  She is a very enterprising woman who enjoys conducting her business, and has an enthusiasm that she brings to bear on a daily basis.  She sells products such as lip pencils, nail polish, lip sticks, powders, creams, treatments, and lingerie.  She gets up early in the morning, at 6 a.m., and works till nine p.m. which is when she returns home.  Her reason for the loan is to buy products for sale.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, nail polish, lipsticks, powders, creams, treatments, and lingerie.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efrain de 31 años de edad trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 5 años, desempeñandose como policia municipal. Esta solicitando  su 4to credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en su casa y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.  Cabe señalar que todos sus creditos los ha utilizado para mejorar su vivienda, y que esta es la segunda vez que solicita el apoyo de kiva, pues con el credito anterior logro mejorar el techo de su casa.
texts.en: 31-year-old Efrain has been working for the Mayor's Office in Juigalpa for 5 years, serving in the municipal police. He has applied for his fourth loan with the goal of building a room in his house to improve his family's quality of life. All of Efrain's loans have been used to make improvements to his home. This is the second time he is seeking the support of Kiva, as with the previous loan he was able to improve the roof of his house.

loans.use: to construct a new room in his house

loans.name: Jose Baciliso

texts.es: Jose de 44 años de edad trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 3 años, desempeñandose como policia municipal. Esta solicitando  su 4to credito con el objetivo de construir los servicios higienicos de su casa para tener mejores condiciones.  Cabe señalar que sus creditos anteriores los ha utilizado para mejorar su casa, pues poco a poco a ido construyendo los cuartos para que su familia cuente con mayor comodidad.
texts.en: 44-year-old Jose has been working for the Mayor's office of Juigalpa for 3 years, serving in the municipal police. He has applied for his fourth loan with the goal of building toilets in his home, to improve his living conditions. It should be noted that his previous loans have been used to improve his home, and gradually he has been building rooms so that his family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to construct toilets in his home

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
A sus 43 años de edad Maria Victoria trabaja con gran esmero en su propio negocio, desde hace 4 años produce y comercializa obleas, ya es reconocida en el sector y diariamente debe cumplir con los pedidos que sus clientes le hacen, trabaja de 7:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. pues generalmente tiene buen flujo de producción. 

Sin embargo hace poco tuvo dificultades con la electricidad y una máquina, lo que le ha impedido prestar un buen servicio y entregar a tiempo los pedidos, es por tal motivo que hoy Maria Victoria se ve obligada a pedir un préstamo con el cual arreglar la máquina y comprar resistencias para mejorar la parte eléctrica, ella no cuenta con este capital y es conciente que solo de esta manera su negocio le generará nuevamente los ingresos necesarios y mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Victoria is 43 years old and works with great care in her own business. For the last 4 years she has been making and selling obleas [Colombian wafers often served with a caramel milk filling sandwiched between two wafers]. She is already known in the industry and she has daily orders that she must meet from customers. She works from 7:00AM until 7:00PM. Generally she has a good production stream.

Nonetheless, just recently, she had problems with a production machine’s electrical part, which has prevented her from providing good service and delivering her orders on time. This is the reason that today Maria Victoria is compelled to ask for a loan with which she will fix the machine and buy electrical resistors in order to fix the electrical part. She does not have the cash and is aware that only in this way can her business once again generate the necessary earnings to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To repair a production machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a kitchen.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: Julio Antonio tiene 39 años su actividad es la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, él ha luchado por sobrevivir con este negocio que es lo más importante para mantener a su familia. Todas las compras de la variedad de sus productos las realiza en Managua. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, vestidos, tallas grandes en camisetas entre otros.
texts.en: Julio Antonio is 39 years old and works selling used clothes.  He has had this business for more than three years, and has succeeded in surviving with this business, which is critical for supporting his family.  He buys the full range of his products in Managua.  The loan that he is requesting is for purchasing trousers, shirts, dresses, clothes in large sizes and T-shirts among other things.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, dresses, clothing in large sizes and T-shirts among other things.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mariam dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil to sell.

loans.name: Duterimbere/nymgn Group

texts.fr:
Fulgence  fait partie du groupe Duterimbere/NYMGN. Le nom du groupe signifie «  ». Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 1 enfant de 1 an. 

Fulgence est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter d’autres terrains de champs du riz afin d’augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Fulgence voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fulgence is a member of Duterimbere/NYMGN Group. He's 32 years old, married, and has one child, who is one year old.

Fulgence is a rice cultivator, and he is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growth is to buy other lots in the paddy field in order to increase his production. In the forthcoming years, Fulgence would like to be among the best rice cultivators in his valley. He plans to use his profits to provide his children with education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business
